text: 750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, long lasting, dense white head, rich lacing. Citrus and grassy hoppy aroma, peppery yeast, herbal and mild floral. Light and crisp mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Hoppy citrus taste, grapefruit, grassy, floral, herbal and belgo yeast. Pleasant bitterness in the finish, crisp and refreshing!

Bottle.
Pours murky dark yellow with a huge frothy white head. Nice!
Aroma has lots of citrus/grapefruit, malt sweetness, yeast and clove/herbs.
Taste is refreshing, sweet and surprisingly bitter with some yeast and caramel/cookie doughy shining through.
Medium body, high carbonation, round yet dry mouth feel.
Long lingering bitter after taste.
A great thirst quencher that surprised me by the high bitterness, I expected something more traditionally hopped but the modern hops doesnt take overhand.
Bottled at Dustys Cellar. Delicious and great for a hot day. Long grapefruit finish.

Slightly darker than golden, quite hazy on second pour. Big and quite dense white head, good retention and very nice lacing. Quite vivid aroma of hay, fresh fruitiness (yellow fruits in the likes of peach, pear, lemon), slight peppery spiciness and a grassy hint. Overall it kind of feels like farmland on a sunny day. Taste has crackery malts base, fruitiness as per nose, slight spiciness and an earthy/yeasty feeling on the back of things. Overall slightly on the sweet side with a good dose of herbal/grassy hops in a still mildly bitter finish. Maybe feeling a bit less bright in taste than in the nose. Light bodied with quite high carbonation, with a lively but still very easy mouthfeel. Nicely refreshing and decently complex. A well made, very belgian beer.

0.75 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. (Tasted Apri 28, 2017.) Appearance is golden, cloudy and with a big Belgian head. First impression is smoky, but that must been from the spices, except this does not have any spices. Just American hops, which is untypical for Belgian beers. Very tasty and dry. I could have had another bottle.

very refreshing blonde. White, elegant and steamy head. fruity notes that give it all its freshness.The aroma is very particular with clear herbaceous, fruity notes, and there is a clear sense of the presence of spices.Not too persistent bitterness.

Bottle 75 cl. Slightly unclear golden in color with a foamy whitish head. Garden fruits, summer meadow floral and bit of fruity sweetness in aroma. Garden fruityness, some bitterness and floral notes in taste.

Draft pour into a 500 ml shaker glass. The beer is a clear yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma is dry and a little herbal. Some apice and ester notes come through. Sweet and herbal taste overall. Nice stuff.
Pours hazy yellow orange with small frothy head. Aroma is bread, hay, apple, citrus, honey, pear, herbs. Light sweet, medium bitter, wooden somewhat astringent aftertaste. Nice

75cl Bottle @ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Hazy golden colour with tall white head.
Aroma is malt, sweet, citrus, floral.
Taste is bread, sweet, yeast, citrus, spices.
Medium body, lively carbonation.

Pours a short white head with spring hops aromas. Light gold colored body. Light in mouth but very elegant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Grande bouteille 75cl. Bière dorée avec une mousse discrète. Au nez, herbacée. En bouche, dabord légèrement acidulée, puis plus douce sur le malt et puis en fin de bouche amertume nuancée. Très belle bière particulièrement équilibrée.
UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 Big bottle at home. Cloudy straw colour, big foamy white head. Floral, light citrus hoppy, grainy, dry yeasty: hopped-up saison fits the bill. Medium body and carbonation.

Unclear, golden colored, medium white frothy head, good lasting. Aroma is of some malt, honey, some fruity and herbal notes, some yeast. Taste is medium sweet malt, honey, some fruity and herbal notes, bit citrusy, medium spicy bitterness, some yeast, dry peppery finish and lasting bitter aftertaste. Medium- bodied, average carbonation.
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Bottle from beer[malade].  Hazy orange golden color with huge white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, citrus hops. Taste starts malty, caramelly, followed by nice citrus hoppy bitterness, yeast. Medium long dry hoppy bitter finish. Nice refreshing beer.

On tap at Raf. Golden color, hazed, thick white head, plenty of lacing. Aroma of citrus, pale malts, belgian yeast and mild hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. Taste was refreshing, light tart, fairly dry, nice.
Yellow, small head, fruity aroma, apple, peach, grainy, flavor of apple, light bitterness, herbal, sweetish, medium bodied.

Bouteille 3/4l. Belle blonde à mousse blanche plutôt persistante. Arômes floraux, houblon, levure, épices, fruits jaunes. Bouche agréable, houblonnée : fruits et amertume discrète mais constante dans la longueur. Une des bonnes "Rulles" (elles sont presque toutes bonnes!).

Beer gold, orange veiled, excellent foam. finely hopped and inviting nose, with hints of honey and buds full of nectar. Palate even more sweet with hints of apple, with a final very bitter and hoppy citrus tips. very refreshing and perfect balanced  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Schaum: dicke
Farbe: umbra satt leicht trüb
Nase: weizig fruchtig, ganz leicht Keller.
Geschmack: schaumig voll, etwas bitter, ein bisschen in die richtung eines Ipa, der abgang hat einen Hauch aSüßes, dann wieder eher wie ein angedeutetes IPA, bitterorange getreide. Kein besonderer Nachgeschmack, leicht fruchtig bitter. Sehr nette mischung. Eine mischung aus belg. Landbier und ipa.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 Biondo turbina con cappello bianco frizzante. Aroma un pochino debole di erbe, lievito, agrumi. Meglio al palato, inizia dolce e poi sopraggiunge un discreto amaro secco. Agrumi, amaro, paglia, erbe. Carbonazione medio alta. Corpo medio. Pensavo un pochino meglio.

Draught. Pours bit hazy, yellow with nice head. Aroma is sweet malty with floral and citrusy notes. Sweetish and zesty with spices and flowers in taste, nice bitterness after. Good, light and drinkable blond.

4 oz pour on draft at The Sovereign shared by solidfunk, thanks Josh! Slightly hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, spice, citrus. Tastes of herbs, spice, citrus, orange peel. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Light Belgian florals and some sweet malt. Hazy golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet finish. Tap at Sovereign.
De geur is zaaaaaalig. De kleur mooi blond. De smaak is heel lekker, maar als ik af ging op de geur had ik de smaak iets pittiger verwacht, het is iets fletser dan verwachter.

Dorata con riflessi arancio e oro, opalescente, schiuma bianca fine e di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di lievito da Saison, paglia, leggero chiodo di garofano, citrica e acidula, note floreali.
Al palato pulizia esemplare: si passa dalla paglia e i chiodi di garofano alla crosta di pane, leggerissimo miele, note floreali, finale amaro di scorza di pompelmo.
Corpo medio-leggero, ben carbonata.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. A golden opaque beer, light hazy, with a big white foamy head ; good retention ; ok lacing. Herb, resin, lemon, light spice. Medium dry bitter refreshing ; acid and sweet note. Light body, thin texture, good carbonation, dry herbal fruity finish. Overall, a good blond belgian ale ; lighter and more fruity than Rulles Blonde.
Hazy orange with a small foam top. Yeasty bitterness, earth, peach, bread, lemon zest. Long finish with dry mineral water, bitters

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy amber body with a thick white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of caramel, banana bread and raisins. Flavour of bread, earth, flowery hops, lemon and a peppery finish. Medium body with a spritzy mouthfeel. Very fizzy. Deliciously refreshing.

Hazy yellow-ish body with a white head. Moderate aroma of grains, biscuits and faint fruits. Is it supposed to smell like this? Moderate flavour that follows the aroma  this is all dull malty grainy notes, and no hops or yeast whatsoever. Hopefully a bad bottle (but mfroseth claimed he liked the beer, so maybe its just me).
[75 cl bottle, served at room temperature placed in a bucket of ice, shared with mfroseth, @ Den Gamle Major, Majorstua, Oslo]
Bottle, 750 ml, shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Pours cloudy yellow, large white head. Fruity aroma. Yeasty, spicy, citrus, some hoppy notes. Bitterish finish. Good.

Goud donkergeel, iets troebel, mooie foamy schuimkraag die blijft.
Aroma: Hint van grapefruit, iets kruidig, grassig en een zoetige fruit en een licht brett  achtig gisting aroma.
Smaak: Fruitig, zwarte bes, gist....wederom denk ik aan een brett wilde gist. Ook een pijnboom / hars hint en grassig / floraal.....goed gehopt, ergens ook een kruidige prikkeling die uit de hop zal komen. Een lange nabitter die lang aanhoud.. ook in combinatie met de CO2.....erg prettig.
Body is medium, koolzuur is veel, mondgevoel is redelijk zacht tikje waterig maar wel aktief.
Een prima Belgische Blonde!
Metallic aroma with some floral notes. Citric hoppy flavour, mild though. Watery texture.
Maljassa 5/2016. Fresh and hoppy, quite pale Belgian ale. Quite light, still enjoyable.

Goudblond met wandklevend wiit schuim. Geur: hoppig, citrus, perzik, en een beetje moutzoetigheid. Smaak: lekkere droge bitterheid, citrus en wat den. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Matig volmondig. Afdronk: citrus bitter. Mooie dorstlesser.

On tap in Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Clear blonde beer with a medium to large foam head. Nose is hop forward, green hops, grassy, grain husky, lemon. Like De Ranke Xx. Taste is acidic green floral hops, grain husky.

Pours just a tad hazy golden color, topped with a medium sized white head, quickly settling. Sweet fruity nose, peaches and apricots. Herbal bittery feel in the taste, slightly yeasty. Bittery finish. Fairly light body. Not bad, a decent one.

Bottle sample at DSGs 10K tasting at the Dancing Camel. Thanks Yoav! Clear gold with a white film. Hoppy-nettle aroma, some spices and a little green too. Mild bitterness, a little soft pine taste. Light body, bitter, hop-oil finish.

Une blonde dorée coiffée dune mousse élégante et persistante. Un nez de poire et dananas dès les premiers instants. Ensuite ce sont de vieilles levures usées; ça sent le vieux continent. Les saveurs sont poivrées, acidulées et on goûte bien ;es levures avant quon détecte une douce amertume en arrière-goût. Ça picote et ça pétille, mais dune façon bien douce et appropriée. Leffervescence est juste à point. Ce fut une dégustation plaisante. (MA 01-17) (1743-050216)
Tap at tuulensuu, tampere. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma has citrus, some yeast, malts. Nice crispy taste, sour fruity notes, citrus.

Botella. Presencia dorada con espuma blanca persistente y carbonatacion media alta. Aroma a pan, melocoton y algo de pino. Sabor de primeras ligeramente dulce y pan con un amargor medio citrico e intenso final lupulado. Muy buena
Tap at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, some sourness, tartness and malts. Very nice.

Bottle sample at DSGs 10K celebration tasting. Thanks Yoav. Hazy yellow with a big head. Aroma is fruity and spicy. Sweet fruity, grassy, floral, herbal and spicy flavors, notes of citrus and yeast with mild bitterness. Medium-bodied, dry-ish aftertaste. Decent.

Bottle sample at DSGs 10K rating celebration tasting at Dancing Camel, Tel Aviv. Thanks to who. Hazy golden with medium creamy off-white head. The aroma has notes of spices, yeasts and some graininess, soapy. The flavor has hoppy bitterness, spicy, notes of salted snack and citrus, slightly dry. Medium-bodied.

At a tasting, thanks, quite big and a little dense bubbly head, lightly hazy very pale orange color, aroma of yeast and herbal tea with some spice, light sweetness, medium citrusy bitterness, some candy and almond with a hint of tea, not too heavy. Nice and pleasant.
750ml Bottle at home, 19th February 16. Pours straw colour, aroma is grass, citrus, floral, yeast. Taste is tangy, yeast, grass, floral, bitter hops. Fresh and enjoyable to drink

750ml bottle, picked up in a Brussels supermarket for about £3. Hazy gold. Thin, dense, clingy, lasting, white head. Nose has tangy, fruity, soft tropical fruit, bright hop. Some sorbet. Some grapefruit juice. Soft, vanilla malts. Taste is fresh, pithy, zesty bitter. Soft, grainy sweetness. Medium body. Soft, foamy mouthfeel. Lemon bitter, tangy finish. Lovely.

Très léger/raffraichissant, mais définitivement pas insipide! Une belle bière dorée qui me semble un hybride entre une belge classique et une saison. Vraiment bien balancée, elle est nest pas trop sucrée et les houblons participent au style à merveille. Très bon!
Gold with white head. Mild citric/spice aroma. Zesty spicy refreshing flavour. Medium bodied, tasty ale.

Bottle. Aroma is floral, grassy, elder, herbal, hints of lemon. Deep golden orange, hazy, nice head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, taste is floral, elder, lemon, hoppy, small hint of light malts. Light body, average carbonation, medium long slightly bitter finish. Decent, but did not like the floral aspect.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 
Aroma:

Slight aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, orange, brettanomyces, apple, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque amber/orange beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet, slightly bitter and slightly acidic with malts, Belgian yeast, orange, brettanomyces, apple, hops and citrus.

Bomber. Yeasty nose, floral, estery, and with a light citrus zest invests. Medium light straw color, Fresh citrusy initial, almond bitterness, more citrus, and lingering bitter tracks. Thin-medium body. Pleasant, simple, all very fresh.
75 cl bottle. Cloudy orange, medium white head. Yeasty aroma, sweet flavour of malt, slightly acidic, hoppy finish

28/11/2015 15cl sample @WBF2015, Bierhalle deconinck, Vichte.
Hazy golden with nice white head. Grains, fruity, floral, bitter, some honey. Very nice for this ABV, must be superb in summer.

Bottle, 0.75l, shared with Patrick. Pours hazy earthy amber color with thin creamy white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of citrus, yeast, flowers and herbs. Taste starts mild sweet grainy, following is refreshing citric, yeasty and peppery, mouthfeel is dry, while finish is mild bitter. Medium body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Fresh and easy going Belgian Ale...

F: huge, stable, white.
C: orange, gold, hazy, opaque.
A: nice citrusy fresh hoppy, hint of dusty and yeast.
T: very good balanced citrusy, grapefruit, orange peels hoppy with some malty tones, peach, grassy, honey, hint of earthy, light pepper, strawberries, medium body, very lively carbo, dry yeasty hoppy bitterness on the palate, very tasty, I like IPA and this reminds me it, worth to try.

Bottle: Augustijn glass:
Medium sized creamy white head.
Cloudy hazy yellow orange body.
Aroma and flavour are mostly dominated by a honey tone. Besides the honey theres herbal grassy bitters and some yeast with apples. Also a pils malt tone in the aroma...
Quite refreshing and gets better with a little time to acclimate in the glass...
Aftertaste is herbal bitter, light fruity, light hoppy and a yeasty sprinkle.
Low carbo, light watery mouthfeel, medium bodied. Nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Medium white head, golden copper colour, yeasty malts smell, medium bitter medium carbonation, hoppy some spicy
Hazy yellow with thick white head. Good lacing. Ripe peach, clementine, herbal and sweet Belgian yeast. Dry, fruity, thick and hoppy finish. Overall: Wow! Probably the best pale ale i´ve tried.

Bottle from Beergium. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, yeast, spices, a bit of floral hops, peach and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, yeast, floral hops, peach and grass. Excellent belgian ale.
Hazy yellow color with huge head. Aroma is lovely fruity, yeast. Flavor is malt, yeast, fruits.
Light blonde with an average frothy head, yeast film in the bottleneck. Hoppy and grassy. Dry with a biter finish. Light bodied, medium to high carbonation. Refreshing.
Yeasty, hoppy, bready, grainy, dry. Hazy amber, white head, lacing. Light sweetness, pronounced yeastiness. Light body, average carbonation, yeasty-dry finish. Good!!

Top fermenting yeast from Orval Trappiste Brewery Very fresh and hoppy in the nose and on the palate - ideal "complex" summer refresher with an amazing array of fruity-citrusy notes IBU 35

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
Geel ondoorzichtig bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt zoet, kruidig en hoppig. Smaakt banaan, kruidig.
Mooie gele kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, citrus, honing. Smaakt fruitig, citrus, honing. Tikkeltje dun.
Frisse doordrinker. Flink hoppig. Beetje hoog in koolzuur. Lekker, maar niet heel bijzonder.
aroma malts citrus clear appearance bright yellow taste hops Citra dry taste not a bad one
Straw color, white head. Citrus nose, mango, Belgian yeast, banana. Fruity esters taste, sweet, citrus, caramel malt, light bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation.

A perfect beer for every season. Perfect balanced between malts and hops. 
Golden, a little bit cloudy and white cream. Very fresh and hoppy. A really like the fruits and bitter in my mouth.
This beer rulles!!
THE perfect Belgian pale ale. Super thirst quenching. Aroma is very floral and grassy, a lot of grains and yeast. Taste is superb; medium bitterness, yeast, grains, hops. Perfect summerbeer.
On tap at Biercab. Golden-amber colour with white head. Yeast, spices, citric aroma. Sweet, yeast, spices, citric taste. Medium body.

bottle.
Thick creamy white head. Hazy golden pour. Easy drinking beer with a slight bitter aftertaste

Bottle 75cl.
hay, toast, caramel, leaves, citrus, grass, golden, cloudy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter,
On tap at Delirium Village. Golden appearance, thick cap. Bitter taste, also the same for aroma. Overall rather modest in all elements.

Bottle.
yellow with heavy white head.
Apricot and grape fruit aroma.
apricot taste, mild bitterness.
Balanced palate.
Flaska från SB. Dimmigt ljusgul med vitt skum. Doft av citrus. Lätt och besk med citrus och jäst.
750ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Medium frothy white head. Pale orange cloudy body. Aroma is mostly fruity belgian yeast. Floral hops. Peach. Mostly sweet on the tongue with a nice fruity finish.

Pours a cloudy deep gold with big white head. Fairly low intensity aroma with some feint yeasty, banana hints, some preserved peaches, pine resin and soil. Medium bodied palate with good freshness and malty overtones. A grapefruit-like bitterness kicks in late and lingers for a minute or so.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella. Amarillo pajizo, espuma blanca cremosa. Frutal, cítrica, levadura, en boca mas florall y lupulada, punto amargo...equilibrada, fresca. Entra sola.Birroterr
bottle sample, poured a yellow to golden colour. notes of citrus, coriander, belgian yeast, orange, floral hops, cut grass, refreshing brew.

Bottle at La Porte Noire, Brussels. It pours hazy golden with a decent white head. The nose is soft, juicy, big floral action, dough and elderflower. The taste is bitter, big floral action, doughy, some bitterness, light pepper, lemon rind, strawberry, dough and biscuity malt with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well-rounded and quaffable.

Sampled @ Tilquin English Beer Festival 2015

Trübe goldene Farbe, schöne weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, grasig, hopfig, Citrus. Geschmack sehr bitter hopfig, grasig, frisch hopfig.
Lys brun tåkete med høyt hvitt skum. Sitrus, sitron og blomsterlukt. Syrlig, grapefruktbitter og litt pepperig smak. Kort
Sweet, light, and dry, with nice mellow hops which linger. A little sticky in the end, surprising as it goes down a little thin. Interesting for sure but maybe not balanced.
The true definition of what should be a modern Belgian beer. Well realized, well balanced, shining hops without being much bitter and refreshing above all.

Draft 0.25l at Moeder Lambic Brussels Belgium.Pour it little bit hazy golden color with big white head.On the nose floral.Taste and aroma of sweet fruits, Belgian yeast and hops on the end.Little bit light all together but ok decent one.

Colore biondo leggermente opaco, bella schiuma.
Odore erbaceo, citrico, fruttato.
Sapore che conferma lodore, subito molto erbaceo, citrico, la dolcezza del malto esce fuori seguita subito dallamaro, bello ma non eccessivo. Molto beverina. Sembra una American Pale Ale.

Aroma: The smell is mainly citric, lemon, grape-fruit and a whiff of nettles, sweet biscuits and some sour milk.Appearance: A slightly hazy dark golden beer, a white large and firm head leaving lots of lacing.Taste: Some small up front sweetness, like a loafer, then acidity a bit raw, and an alkaloid bitterness.Palate: Rather high carbonation, yet surprisingly watery and flat, a dry finish.Overall: Hard to really get a grip of, nice aromas but an uneven taste spectrum.Note: Bottle, 750 ml. Reviewed 2010-06-28.

Robe or, reflets ambrés, mousse discrète. Nez sur les fruits, les agrumes,la levure, une note de houblon et dépices. Bouche à la belle attaque fruitée et amère, belle élégance de bouche et finale très raffraîchissante. Une belle bière de plaisir.
On tap at the Shep on 12/17/09. Golden with thin head. Lemony tart aroma. Dry bitter up front, crisp, finishes clean.

Shared 0.75cl bottle in Daiseys (Brugge) on 8th Feb 2015. Slight haze to the golden pour, on top a thin white covering. Hoppy nose with a healthy yeast backbone to the aroma. Taste similar with a semi-sourness to the whole flavour: leaning towards a farmhouse saison in style, in my opinion. Decent and certainly refreshing after a couple of dark, heavy brews before it.
Tap. Crisp light yellow. Nice head. Mildly Belgian yeast nose. Even more mild Belgian yeast character. A bit too much dry hopping -- readslike a Belgian pale ale (though nice still).
Golden hazy with medium white bit creamy head. Hoppy aroma. Bitter citrusy taste with perfect sourness, some touch of sweet around the tongue. Refreshing. Bitter aftertaste.

Pours slightly hazy pale gold with three fingers of rocky white head, excellent retention and lacing. (5/5) Nose is floral and herbal, dusty funk, mild citrus and stone fruit. (8/10) Taste is mild sweet, mild bitter, very mild tart. (8/10) Light body, moderate carbonation, dry crisp finish. (4/5)

I like this a lot - a very restrained BPA with elements of farmhouse saison, just enough sweetness to balance the mild floral and herbal hops, and a hint of dusty funk to make things interesting. A nice summery beer on a cold and windy winters day. I could drink a lot of this - too bad Ive only got the one bottle. (But good thing its a big one!) (16/20)

Bottle shared @ home from HappyHoppy - Color: hazy blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity and floral notes with good malt balance. Taste: good floral taste and with good hoppy taste. Well balanced with malt. Aftertaste: caramel notes and fruity finish.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 Bottle. Nose is yeast slight herbal notes, slight floral, medicine . Taste is medicinal, straw, yeast, herbal hops. Lack of depth in the short finish. I think my bottle is on the turn, it is not the drink other reviewers have described. Edit. Bottle was duff. New bottle July 16: nose is funk, floral, lemon, spice. Very appealing. Taste is lightly funky, dry hops, malt, pepper, lemon, yeast, medicinal hop and spice finish. Lasting dry finish. Refreshing and pleasing. It?s not as good as the outstanding review of Tim Webb, I think I need to try it much fresher.

Biondissima opalescente e con una schiuma bianca di buona persistenza ma di irregolarità nelle dimensioni delle bolle, Al naso è freschissima....erba appena tagliata, agrumi, anche un sentore di margherita, ma anche crosta di pane. In bocca note maltate in ingresso lasciano ampio spazio a sentori agrumati ed erbacei. Finale piacevolmente asprino e amaricante il giusto. Anche in bocca ti fa immaginare di sorseggiarla in spiaggia sotto un ombrellone tanto è dissetante, beverina e fresca, ma non una bottiglia (da 75 è la dimensione azzeccata, minimo sindacale procapite), una spina intera (luogo modalità di somministrazione e stagione ideale, ma che anche a gennaio fa la sua porca figura).
Refreshing, fruity aroma. Slightly cloudy golden colour, almost no head. Nicely aroma hopped. Mild flavour with OK bitterness, citric, turning acidic. Yeasty aftertaste.
Bottle bbe 01/2016. Nice long lasting head. Aroma pilsner-like, some flowers. Taste is sweet and grainy upfront, then spicy bitterness takes over.

750 ml bottle. Pours a slightly veiled straw with obvious sediments and a thick, very resilient white head. Aroma is pear, peach and vanilla. Flavor is peach, pear, dusty, malty, peppery, minty. Finish is somewhat herbal, a tad bit of bitterness with notes of grapefruit here and there. Very refreshing and drinkable. Medium body, average to strong carbonation. Great Summer ale.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 Nice seasonal beer with a beautiful nose. The first time I had it I was completely overwhelmed but I was quite disappointed on the followings tastings...The finish is a bit too bitter and I think it is because 5.2% is too soft for so much hoppyness... Its though a good refreshing summer beer and who could resist to this wonderful and beautiful man on the label?
Light hazy, deep golden, rich cream head. Aromatic hops, very fresh, honey. Tastes like licking a spoon of honey and balancing with hoppy bitterness. Extremely pleasant.
Faktiskt ganska slätstruket får jag tyvärr konstatera. Absolut drickbart, men inget som fastnar i minnet.

Belgian stagionale dorata con schiuma abbondante bianca. Al naso erbacea, speziata e un po agrumata. In bocca molto beverina e piacevole con una bilanciatura leggermente acida. Il sapore floreale e speziato risulta molto rotodo e per niente invadente rendendo questa birra rinfrescante e per tutti gusti. Finale pulito. Molto consigliata!!!

75CL Bottle
Pours light yellow with frothy white head
Aroma is grain bit sweet not much else
Flavour is mild bitter bit o citrus dry bitter finish
nice beer but not a 5 star that some beer writers tells us

Aroma is clove, lemon grass, floral yeast and light sweet malts. Taste is light sweet malts with slight tartiness that mellows out. Appearance is a clear gold body with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.
Blonde dorée voilée, effervescence moyenne, col blanc moyen. Malts pils et cara, amertume houblonnée et herbeuse moyenne, plutôt sèche, légèrement fruitée et miellée. Une bonne bière de soif.
Draft at SIB07. Decent an one of the first around Belgian IPAs. Straw filled with floral hop notes. Straightforward but good!

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Spring ale with yellowish white, creamy, sticky, very stable head and warm orange blonde colour, cloudy. Gentle aroma of banana, orange, pear, honey, yeast, hay, cloves, ginger, chamomille, grassy hops. Fruity, lightly malty taste, subdued sweetness with medium carbo, pure and fully, very subtle sourness, spicier and dryer in the finish ending in an assertive hop bitterishness. Well-balanced, refreshing and one of the best Rulles so far.

Ale belga, gosto e aroma fortes.. Típicos de uma legítima ale. Vale a pena provar

-

e extraordinaire, et pourtant je ne suis pas un fanatique des bières à 5,2 % abv
(un peu maigrichon), mais disons que lesprit de celle-ci est plutôt dans le style des blanches,
donc le taux dalcool est « normal » pour ce genre de bière. Ceci dit cette bière est bien une
blonde, mais une blonde dété, faite pour désaltérer. On pourrait dire dans le même sens, 
dans lesprit des saisons, qui sont aussi des bières de désoif pour lété.
Cette artisanale refermentée en bouteille est une grande bière.
Couleur doré moyen brillant. Clarté nette. Bulles moyennes à fines partout dans le verre, 
pareille à un feu dartifices. (Et pourtant mon exemplaire de 75 cl est à date en mars 2013,
donc tout juste au timing...). Mousse blanche, épaisse et bien crémeuse. Superbe.
Arômes de houblons très fins, avec une touche de pamplemousse rose et de fleurs des bois (la brasserie est située en Gaume, tout près de la grande forêt de lArdenne, et de la superbe forêt dAnlier, cela lui donne de linspiration ).Splendide. 
Texture de la 1ère bouche quasi veloutée, saveurs magnifiques de houblons et
malts confondus et aussi séparés. Arrière-bouche avec une pointe de piment, et lamertume
dun superbe houblon. 
La 2ème bouche donne une splendide ampleur de la texture, avec toujours cette amertume fine.
La 3ème bouche est pleine, entière, magique. Rétro-nez toujours bien houblonné.
La longueur est très constante, avec des nuances de fleurs, des fruits blancs et une pointe 
dépices fines.
Lalcool est bien dans lesprit de la saison, cest très bien ainsi (ça me coûte de le dire),
et il est bien proportionné.
La levure (et ici, pour autant que lon laisse un peu de volume de bière avec la levure de
refermentation, on est en droit de penser à la couleur dune blanche dans le verre, mais
une blanche bien dense ) est superbe, précise, fine, douce, délicieuse, soyeuse, délicate,
tendre, admirable, aimable, caressante, lisse. Un petit chef doeuvre...
La finale se laisse savourer, humer, ressentir, goûter, déguster autant que vous le souhaitez.
Bière qui est un chef doeuvre pur et simple du brassage artisanal, et qui fait date dans 
lhistoire de la bière. On ne peut quêtre admiratif devant cette beauté de Rulles 
Même si la spécialité de lendroit est plutôt le français avec le grammairien Maurice Grevisse, je vais faire des mathématiques, mais très rapides et intuitives en accordant un 5 à cette merveille.

Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux petites notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes et zeste, notes de pommes, faibles traces de mangues) et légèrement épicées (poivre, léger de coriandre) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun moyen-léger goût de grains de malt légèrement sucrés ainsi que des notes de pain puis en finale, lon retrouve une légère-moyenne amertume asséchante de houblon floral aux notes herbeuses. Post-goût moyen-long et un peu sec, léger-moyen amer de houblon floral et herbeux avec un moyen goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes) et épicées (poivre). (2006)

Bottle, sampled at 16th St. Liquor Store, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, bready malts, and some hops. Flavour is similar, with bread, Belgian yeast, and bitter hops. Quite bitter and dry, but full of flavour. Good thirst quenching dry Belgian hop bomb. Great stuff.

0.75l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a near-clear golden one with a nice medium sized heavy lacing off-white top. The nose has a Belgian touch. Soft yeasty, citrus, pomelo, grapefruit, wet leafs and strawberries. Quite enjoyable indeed. Its right below average on the co2 and the mouthfeel is oily. More citrus in the flavor but softer than the aroma. Pomelo is a clue here. Traces of yeast, spices, flowers and fruits. The finish has a light peppery sting. Really easy drinking, but not so good that I feel the need will hunt down another bottle. 06.02.2013

750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy light amber with medium sustained head. Aroma of floral lemon, yeast, spice, and white pepper. Flavors are similar though somewhat delicate with definite spicy lemon notes. Very nice.

Pours hazy golden yellow with a nice white head.  The nose is corn husks, pine and belgian candy sugar.  The taste is an overhwelming bitter punch.  Amazing that I couldnt detect this in the nose.  The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, the body is light and the finish is long.  Nice beer for a hot summer day.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100512.
Pours brown color with a small head. Aroma of caramel malts, toffee, spices, ripe fruits and yeast. Flavor of yeast, toffee, ripe fruits and caramel malts. Very nice.

draft at cml fontainas. 
blonde, no foam, smells floral, hoppy, very bitter, more floral. meh ..

Tap at Ma Che, 11/02/13.
Hazed light amber with a bubbly white head that retains well.
Nose is lemon, spice, grass, orange pith, light yeast notes.
Taste comprises yeast esters, orange, lemon, citrus, spice, grass, light sugars, background hops.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, some bitterness in the finish.
An Ok drinkable effort but not one Ill be rushing back to!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

Two finger foam. Apricot orange colour. Peppery phenols. Yellow fruity notes. One sharp taste and finish. Nice. Rerated 11/7-13. Guren. Super delicious. Citrus notes. Very refreshing. Super brew.

Light hazy orange to browish body with with stable pearl white head. Looking good. Freshly hopped with a light citrus aroma, bit floral, farmhouse yeast and a Belgian IPA appeal. Very fresh yet sufficiently rich taste, with a great drinkability.  Very refrshing - what a Belgian wit always promises but never does for me. Great yeast-forward, no-fuss brew. Yes, they still make good stuff in Belgian. (75cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

On tap in Delirium Hoppy Loft, enjoyed with Faithless Insomnia blasting out of the speakers. Slightly hazy yellow, traditional Belgian ale hop/spice/yeast aroma, bitter finish. Pleasant enough and very drinkabe. It actually has a nice finish, and I rerated it higher as the glass progressed. Still a bit surprised about the very high rating though - there are better Belgian session ales out there.
golden and cloudy with a fast subsiding, white and fluffy head. aroma with light hints of spice and light fruityness. taste is rather bland but with a touch of spice and mellow bitterness.

Bottle at Les Brigittines (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Grass, citrus, and some spice.
Appearance: A cloudy amber color with a white head.
Taste: Medium in bitterness and a bit sweet for a blond.
Palate: Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Really smooth. Incredibly drinkable.
Golden color with white creamy and persistent head. Cereal aroma, also hop fruity, citrus and sour. At taste is light sweet and so drinkable with honey flavour.
0.75l bottle. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a thick lasting white head. Aroma with hints of grass and herbs and yeast. Refreshing citrus and a hoppy character.

750ml bottle BBE 01/02/14. Pours a slightly hazy orange amber with a large, billowy, white head. You can find a lot of fruit in the aroma. Crisp fresh berries, gooseberry in the forefront though some crispy tart currant there as well, white & red. Some passion fruit and pine as well as general dried fruit and spiciness. Taste is strong with the hops. Gooseberries again. Passion fruit and pine too. Spice is strong as well with light yeast and some biscuity malt. Dries the mouth very effectively on the finish with spice, especially pepper. Palate is very carbonated and stingy, medium full. Just superb. Could drink copious amounts. Fortunately quite low in alcohol.

On tap at Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Another ace recommendation by the bartender, whose endorsement of super-fresh Rulles brews was much appreciated. Like the tripel, this one was vibrantly hoppy, right from the first whiff. Big, lustrous body with a moderately dry, gritty finish. Earthy and a bit spicey, its a terrific cross between a hoppy session pale ale and a singel, with saison characteristics to boot.

(From notes 9 Nov, 2012) Tap. White, thick head. Hazy golden/straw pour. Refreshing, grassy hops aroma. Flavor citrusy, bitter. Smooth on the palate. Short citrusy finish. Overall a refreshing beer, very easy to drink.

75cl bottle. pours a beautiful pale orange colour, hints of herb in the aroma, the initial Belgian herby sweetness is very well countered by a fine hop flavour, which is fresh and creamy. Beautifully balanced and an excellent crossover beer covering 2 fine styles. Really really like this, tastes like it should be stronger too.

Duft af citrus og blomst. Dejlig humlet. Uklar gylden øl med små sedimenter. Skøn sommer øl. Bitter sød.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Beer Kitchen in KC.  Comes a cloudy light gold with a small white head.  Aroma of grass, grain, fruit, and yeast.  Taste is lemons, grass, yeast, grain, and spice.  Somewhat dry finish.  Very nice.

bottle-conditioned 750ml.
bbd August 2013, bottled February 2012.
hazed golden wheat body with a fine white head.
heavily perfumy (honeysuckle).
blueberry, white grape and lime ester and hop-heavy nose.
herbal juniper-like aromas with sometimes-hints of bell pepper.
musty, minerally, doughy yeast.
creamy natural carbonation.
exceptionally smooth and soft-textured malt.
strongly bitter with citrus-focused american hop flavor.
cheese rind and must.
more light-bodied than 5% would suggest, reminds me of the lightness of 3.5% Avril.
a strange and difficult beer to wrap my head around.
strange choice of brutish high-acid American hops for a low-gravity Belgian farmhouse ale.
makes me dance!
Id call it a saison.  Light grassy earthy blonde cloudy beer.  Has some light grass and a lot of fruit to it.  Medium body.  Lingering dry finish.
Light and a bit weedy.  Light hop flavors, coming off of an IPA for the previous rating, so its almost imperceptible. Easy drinking.

Bottle at Dans courtesy of Aaron. Thanks man!!! Pour is golden straw with a small head and a few floaters; no visible lacing. Weed, hay, funk, dough, grass, and grain in the aroma. Taste is light spice, grass, lemon peel, bread, vegetables, and grain with a lightly bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Meh.

Bottle @ Dans house. Pours a hazy light golden orange appearance with a cream colored head. Big barnyard, straw, a bit funky, lemon, a bit zesty/spicy aroma. Somewhat tart, a bit chewy bready, orange, somewhat spicy flavor with a touch thick mouth feel.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks Aaron. Hazy orange pour with white head, aroma has notes of diacetyl, biscuit, bread, some peach, pear, hints of earth, touch of grain, grass, hints of grain.  Taste is a mix of grainy, grass, biscuit, some dms, touch of earth, hints of spice, slight pear in there, white grape, finishing fairly bitter, dry.  Decent, but the off flavor throws me off a bit.

75 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2013
Aroma is slightly sweet wit grassy hops, fruits and Belgian yeast. Flavour has grassy hops, some herbal notes, Belgian yeast and hints of fruits. Surprisingly rich for this ABV. Refreshing and good, a real summer drink as the label keeps telling me.
Pours yellow/tan with lacy white head.  Citrus and yeast smell.  Dry, hoppy, yeasty taste.  Citrus and cereal, some spiciness.  Dry finish.
Great bitterness, and a smoky, tasty foam, but too little taste overall. Its a shame, I was really looking forward to this one. Lively, though.
Bottle. Hazy orange body, big white head. Floral aroma, spicy, yeast notes. Taste of hay, pepper, citrus and yeast. Good hopppy and spicy finish.

Bottle to wine glass
Fruity, hoppy, and citrusy. Pours a light amber, close to yellow with small particulates and a nice white head. It's mildly sour with nice bitterness and some Belgian yeasts.

Bottle - Lemon rind, citrus, yeast on the nose.  Beautiful clear gold with a fizzy nice head.   Hoppy from the citrus but conflicts with the yeast.  This has always been a style to flummox me.  Bitter and sour is not good on my palate.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, average and mostly lasting head. Moderate and malty and sweetish aroma, lots of fruitiness with citrus hoppyness, light pepper spiciness. Body is medium, malty and slightly sweetish aroma, fruitiness with citrus hoppyness, light peppery spiciness. Finish is average, malty and dryish, citrus hoppyness with peppery spiciness. Dryish Belgian ale with nice hoppyness and light spiciness.
Pale golden colour. White head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Flavour has malt, spices and citrus in it.

Bottle. Hazy golden amber with thick head and plenty of carbonation. Hoppy nose with lots of earth and field. Tastes bigger than 5.2%. Big body. Flavour is like the scent. Big earty hops, a hint of cheese, a yeast note and a chunk of good taste.

75cl bottle. Pours a yellow and hazy liquid with decent white head. Nose : fresh and strong aromas overall. Mostly grains, fruity soap and hops. Sip : Low density with low carbonation. Bitter with sweet malt background, bit sour with zest dryness. Great refreshment.

0,75 l Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Yellow hazy, big dense white head, wonderful laces. Smells of clove, pepper, yeast and malts. Quite spicy. Light to moderate sweet, makes this a quite dry one. Spicy, ceveral differnt flavors in there, i like it. Moderate bitter, quite grassy. Medium body, average carbonation, watery texture. Totally a very drinkable beer. Quite refreshing and spicy. Big bottle? Yes! Hard to finish alone? No!! :)
una buonissima birra estiva, luppolata in maniera equilibrata. si fa bere molto facilmente e persiste in bocca.

750ml capped bottle pours a light golden orange color with a massive white head that settles to leave some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light cereal grains and mild fruits with a bold hoppy bitterness.  Taste is light fruity sweetness with some malt sweetness as well and a grassy hop bitterness.  Light to medium body with some crazy carbonation leaves a nice feeling on the tongue.  Quite a tasy and hoppy pale ale that is worthy of a tasting experience.
Ottima dirra davvero, estiva, bassa gradazione alcolica, aroma e sapore floreale, luppolatissima beverina ai massimi livelli!

Colore arancio, schiuma di media persistenza. Molto luppolata al naso anche se non mancano note floreali e di malto. In bocca un ottimo sapore assolutamente ben bilanciato e piacevole. Ottimo finale amaro. Beverina e adatta per una serata estiva-primaverile.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of fruity and grassy hops. Taste is crisp and fresp hops, with some nice oranges, light yeast and spices add up on this good brew. Ends dry and hoppy

Shared 75 cl bottle at Cardinal. Fingerthick, tan colored creamy head on a hazy golden body saturated with small particles. Sugary, spicy, wooden, light gooseberry notes on the nose. Spicy, light acidic, sweet, alcoholic and light bitter flavors with notes of dough, yeast and sweat. Medium body.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 Fra flaske på Cardinal: litt (og ikke helt behagelig) aroma. Uklart. Mye syre og beskhet og lite smak. Klart den minst interessante fra La Rulles. Fra fat på Delirium mens jeg venter på at de bestilte flaskeølene blir avkjølt: smooth og velbalansert med en fin humleprofil. Fint venteøl, opp fra opprinnelige 2.5 til 3.2
170811: Hazy golden color large white head. Good fresh easy drinkable summer taste with fine hoppy notes..

A quite tasty pale ale that is well hopped but doesn't hit you in the face. Finish is just a tad flabby. Had on tap at Delirium cafe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Pours a light golden amber colour with a big frothy and off-white head, that becomes bumpy afterwards. Medium carbonated. Aromas of hay, grass and grains. The flavour is dominated by grassy hops but also some sweet malt and hints of belgian yeast. Bitterness = medium+, with a long duration. Watery and a soft mouth feel. A decent belgian ale but nothing very special.

En botella y tirador.Rubia con fina espuma blanca,Aromas florales,citricos......Sin filtrar.ligera y muy refrescante.
Buena para las barbacoas de verano!

Golden ( orange almost) hazy color
Fruitful and integrated hoppe aromas
Medium body & complexity
Very enjoyable
eccellente birra primaverile! chiara leggermente opalescente con un bel cappello di schiuma. Aroma delicato ma tuttavia ha un bel gusto pieno e appagante.

Bottle 750ml @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours cloudy deep golden/orange with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast and clove. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

02/05/2012 Open Baladin (tap). Dorata, viva, intensa, appena torbida, bellissimo cappello di schiuma finissima e morbidissima, pannosa, molto persistente. Naso delicato, lieviti, spezie, luppolo, con note floreali e una punta erbacea. In bocca è magnifica, tanta sostanza, lieviti, malto, luppolo con straordinario finale secco e pulitissimo. Corpo medio, carbonazione perfetta. Gran bella birra.

Tap @ ZBF2012
Really citrus fruity aroma with hops. Taste fruity with mild bitter finish
Tap @ BQ. Hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, hops, little sweet, fresh, little citrus and medium bitter.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2012 Sono rimasto deliziato. Aroma potente di un bouquet erbaceo e un qualcosa di mela cotogna. Al gusto appare subito raffinata e fruttata con un buon amaro di scorze di agrume di fondo. Riscaldandosi si sente anche un pò di malto ma è poca cosa. Retrogusto secco e pulito. Semplicemente deliziosa. Se la vedete compratela. O fateva offrire, che è ancora meglio.
Fine flavor and aroma of fruit, yeast and citrus. The taste is the same with a clear touch of hops and citrus. Nice!

750 ml bottle @ Patricks. Hazy yellow/orange body with a nice, creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, spicy and yeast, hint of lemon. Flavor is relatively light with malt, oranges, lemon, yeast and spices with moderate bitterness. Medium body and aftertaste. Pretty good and quaffable beer without being to complex, but nice and tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2012 17/III/2012 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ "summer house" in the Ardens - BB: XII/12 (2012-242) 
Pretty cloudy yellow to light orange beer, big white head, stable and adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, sweet peaches, pineapple, some passion fruits. MF: good lively carbon, full body. Taste: fruity, peaches, pineapple, citrus., bitter piny touch, some honey. Aftertaste: dry bitter, little cheesy. Very nice.

Aroma of malt, wheat, fruitiness, peach, citrus and floral hops. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some bitterness, fruitiness and some yeast. Medium body, average carbonation. Nice hoppy summer beer.

75cl bottle. Pours a straw colour with a big white head. Quite lasting foam. Aroma is grassy and slightly funky. Some fruity sweetnes and spicyness. Taste is moderately malty with a good amount of bitterness and funky notes. Fruity, grainy and grassy. Flowers and spices. A tad of acidity in the finish makes this beer quite dry and sessionable. Medium body with good  carbonation. Nice and refreshing. Definitely saison-esque.

#1255 draught; nose is very heavy sweet fruit notes, soursweet malt, mellow lemon late, feel is medium, carb is medium, taste is decent dry lemon, cooked vegetables, pilsner malt, some leaves, late weak sour earth

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden, with a thick, full head. Aroma is spicy hops, and some caramel malts. Taste has a weird yeasty acidity, with some notes of biscuits. Finish is a sharp grapefruity spiciness.

Bouteille de 750ml. Bière blonde blé avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est fort agréable, en déplaise à mon ami, mon exemplaire était frais, les notes de fleurs blanches soyeuses côtoient les notes de citron et de houblon. La bouche est tout aussi agréable, la levure est gouteuse, et les houblons laissent en bouche de belles saveurs dagrumes citronnées. Elle est désaltérante de part son coté piquant sur la langue en fin de bouche.

750 ml dark green capped bottle, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo. ABV is 5.2%. Golden colour, large white head.Lovely aroma of fruity American hops, also some piney notes. Fairly light bodied. The flavour is also dominated by American hops from start to finish, piney and fruity notes, bitter finish, but not overdone. Regarding style: Yes, the beer is brewed in Belgium, but the style is closer to an American Pale Ale than a Belgian Ale.

(75 cl)  Une robe dorée et voilée.  Une tête mousseuse blanche qui résiste un moment.  Une dentelle qui décore le verre.  Un nez de houblons fruités avec une touche de poivre.  Des saveurs amères et citriques sur des flaveurs de malts pâles.  Un corps moyen-mince avec de fines bulles.  Une texture légère.  Une finale que se fait sur des fleurs de houblons.  Un manque de fraîcheur?

Bottle. Pours with a decent, very long lasting, white frothy head. Lightly cloudy golden colour, a lot of sparkling. Aroma of fruits (pineapple, grapes, citrus), hops, light yeasts. Light and smooth mouthfeel, well balanced medium to strong bitterness with light to medium sweetness. Dry bitter finish. Very refreshing beer.

On tap at Delirium Cafe, Bruxelles.
Hazy Pale yellow appearance with a nice foamy white head. Interesting spicey aroma with citrusses, lemon peel, light malt, yeats. Easy bodied one, taste of a belgian blond with yeast and coriander plus án interesting character of the unusual hops like grape and pine.

From backlog @ beerpassieweekend 
Head: off white, creamy 
Colour: light yellow 
Smell: yeasty, citric, peels, grapefruit, bitter 
Taste: nice refreshing bitter start with some citric notes , a bit of malt , some hops , yeast , end is dry , very good !

One of the best "summer" brews imaginable; OK so this review starts with a spoiler, but anyway the rating is visible, aint it? Green 750cc bottle with light green label depicting the usual "Rulles" character, feet plunged in the water, enjoying a glass of fine ale while out fishing; a bike in the background suggests he will not drive a car to get back home, and thats fine, I guess. Pours opalescent gold to amber with beautiful consistent white foam head; nose is dominated by the subtle texture of hops. It is very hard to brew such a complex and refined beer with such muscular American herbs, but this exceptional brewer, Gregory Verhelst, succeeded; and now this is no less Belgian and "classic" than older and full European labels. In the mouth, an explosion of herbal freshness, but anyway of good balance. This is definitely a great, savory, summer ale, and Im telling you now, in the heart of winter. Cheers!
Fra fat på Delirium Café i Brussel 7 Mai 11. Delt med Rune. Lys gylden. Uklar. OK skum som setter nivåmerker på glasset. Mye sitrus i nesen. Smaken er rikt fruktig med en overvekt av sitrus. God!

Full lasting foamy white head. Cloudy deep golden colur. Aroma is moderately malty with citrusy (tangerine), fruity (pear), hoppy and spicy (white pepper) notes. Flavor is moderately malty with grapefruit, green apricot and very light candy sugar tones, ending in an hoppy, citrusy prolongued finish. Light to medium bodied.

It starts out with fruity sweetness and yeast notes, but finishes off quite bitterly. Grains, yeast, fruits and even hops on the nose. It pours a murky amber colour, head is white and massive, but diminishes quickly. Leaves gracious lacings on the glass. (Bottle)

Tap at Delirium, Brussel.
A very nice refreshing blond ale with lots of fresh hops that leaves the palate nicely dry. Really nice when fresh.
Hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma and taste of hops, citrus, yeast and hay. The body was light and the beer refreshing. A good summer beer me thinks.

On keg at The Little Delirium Cafe. Pours a slightly hazy blonde colour with a thick white head. Saison-type aroma of lemon and white pepper with pine and grapefruit hop characters. Similar flavours with a caramel and barley backbone, lemon citrus and white pepper again. Nicely bitter with an oily mouth-feel. Moderate carbonation and mild CO2 prickle. Lemony pine linger. Great!
