BBF 02/2017. Hazy orange with a creamy off-white head. Nose is light esters & white pepper, puffy fresh white bread dough, sweet with very faint grass. Taste is nice hops, green grass, white pepper, nice green hops, lovely EU / De Ranke / De La Senne style but carries a bit more sweetness than those beers, white dough, sweet peach, white bread, dash yeasty,  Creamy sweetish yeast, lightly milky body. Really nice hoppy rustic beer, could be a touch cleaner & drier but really nice rustic new school beer in the style of De Ranke / De La Senne. (4.4/5)

A surprisingly good belgian ale. Not a typical belgian ale, much more hoppy taste and less sweetness than the typical belgian ale. The nose is very appealing according to my taste. This smells really good, and it also tastes very good. It was a familiar scent and taste, and I guess its for whats probably my favourite hop: Amarillo. Excellent beer in my opinion, it combines the best of two worlds.

75cl bottle at Håndverkerstuene. Light golden colour with a small head. Hazy light orange colour. Aroma is farmhouse, wheat and hints of belgian yeast. Flavour is bitter, but not much. Hints of wheat, water, yeast, hops and some malts.

Dark amber, creamy head..
Fruity aroma, strong flavor. Apricots, prunes, some Beligian yeasty sourness,  Smooth, yet there is some darkenss underneath. Earth, leather - but very discreet. A modest funkiness combines drinkability with complexity, 
Even modestly priced in Norway.
Draught at Delirium Hoppy Loft, Brussels, Belgium august 2011. Yellow, hazy with white head. Citrus and hoppy aroma. Hoppt taste, a bit bitter.

Bottle bought at Vanuxeem warehouse, Ploegsteert, Belgium. An amber/golden coloured pour with a healthy off white head on top. Fruity, malty Belgian aroma. Tastes hoppy, fruity, yeasty, slight bitterness. Really like this brewery.

Lite av en överasking. Inte alls typiskt belgisk. Ingen jäst karaktär och sötma utan ganska stramt torr, viss citrushumle och rejäl beska, nåja för att vara belgare alltså. Åt pale ale hållet i stilen, men bättre. Lätt men ändå smakrikt. Bra sommaröl.
Draft. Bready, yeasty, tasytes of carmel, lemon and sponge cake. Very easy drinkinhg. Nice

Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of yeast, fruity hops, peach, citruss. Taste is yeast, fruity hops, citruss, dry and bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. 170811
(Bottle 17/08-2011) Slow fading large white head, unclear yellow, hoppy yeast aroma, medium bitter, thin to medium body.
Cloudy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170811

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pale golden color with white frothy head. Smells hoppy, citrussy, very refreshing. Starts hoppy bitter, very tart, with lots of citrus aroma. Middle part is very hoppy bitter, slightly grassy, with lots of citrus. Finish is grassy hoppy tart, slightly fruity-citrussy.
Una belgian ale con le contropalle, davvero fatta come si deve, bevuta alla spina va giù che è una meraviglia...

Draft at the Birch.  Light golden amber with great lacing.  The aroma is exceptionally floral and perfumey.   The beer drinks with a moderate hoppy flourish but is quite light and refreshing.  (#4185, 7/23/2011)
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, spice, yeast and with floral notes.

Unclear light golden with an incredibly beautiful and lively white foamy head. Aroma is light acidic and citrusy with some spruce. Taste is hoppy bitter and very fresh, with notes of citrus and a touch of brett. Body is light, carb is fizzy, finish is long, astringent and bitter. An instant summer favorite.
Draft. Pours amber orange with a white head. Spicy yeasty aroma with some floral notes. The flavor has spicy yeast with floral notes and herbal and grainy notes. Nice.

Appearance is gold with rich 2 finger head and good retention.  Aroma is funk, pepper, hint of citrus, hay, and toast.  Taste is mildly roasty (more roasty than you would think is possible given the color) with a bright citrus hop middle and a hay-like finish.  Body is medium, creamy, average carbonation, and has a wet yeasty finish.  Overall, this is a good pale ale made far more interesting by the use of a very complex Belgian yeast strain.
Had at Delirium in Brussels. This was a beer that was recommended by one of the bar tenders. It was very smooth. This was a very smooth. I think I could drink this all day long.

Draft. Pour is clear gold, with a nice white head and moderate retention. Aroma is grainy/husky, spicy belgo yeast, a bit of citrus/floral character. Flavor is very grainy, citrus/floral hops. Palate is mostly dry, soft carbonation, overall very nice.

Draft at Toronado SF.  Rather clear and golden in color with a small white head and great lacing.  Nice Belgian aroma, moderately yeasty with white pepper and some earthy and woody hints.  Pale malt base on the flavor with a great spicy peppery yeast note and earthy hops.  Very dry.  Nice tingly mouthfeel with moderate carbonation, rather drying on the finish.  An excellent example of the style overall.  Really enjoyed this one.

Comes out of the tap a hazy golden yellow with a fine-bubbled cream-white head that leaves substantial lacing. Aroma is fruity, sweet and a little malty/wheaty. Crisp flavor is malty and fruity, both pomme and citrus, with hints of honey and wood/rye. Texture is fairly smooth and has a subtle fizz. Happy Summer!

Hazy golden orange body and a large rocky lasting head. Aroma of malt, fruity, yeasty and lots of hops - citrus, grass, pine. Well balanced beer. Medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter. Nice refreshing.

ZBF 2008 
Süßlich-bitterer Kräutergeruch. Frisch, etwas hopfig, deutliche Wassernote. Kaum würzig, im Abgang leicht kräuterartig, mild. 	 
Test vom 5.3.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 11,8,9,9,-,9 - 9,05

draught at monks cafe. Cloudy orange with a fluffy white head.  Bretty, dry, hops, light bread, starfruit.  So, so good.  Finally found this fresh and it is everything I thought it could be. So boss. I wish I would have gone back for more.

On tap at Delirium Café in Brussels. Cloudy golden, solid lacing-head. Hop fruity aroma. Taste of grapefruits and oranges mingled with spices. Smooth, dry bitter finish. Refreshing and moreish (shared with Finn, Brussel 07.05.2011).

Growler from Ridgeview Liquor in Ashwaubenon WI.  Light cloudy gold.  Smallish head.  Slightly bitter, citrussy aroma.  Awesome flavor!  A hops dominated taste but by no means too bitter.  Really different for a Belgian Ale.  Relatively low ABV - think it was 5.2%.  A tasty thirst quencher that should please hopheads and the Belgian ale crowd.
Draft at Isaac newtons. Golden hazy pour with whitish head.  Citrus,  light grain and yeast tones. Almost a prima pils with a Belgian kick. Nice!

Pours golden from tap with a substantial white head that dissipates in time and leaves some nice lacing. Nice grapefruit aroma on the nose. The spice notes and the hoppy flavor intermingle. A fan would say theyre nicely balanced a cynic would say the cancel each other out. My opinion of this beer changes every other sip.

Appearance: Yellow golden. Initially clear, later some haze. Lots of white head.
Aroma: Fruit, apple. Some lemon and yeast.
Taste: Fruit, hops. Spices. Bitter aftertaste
Info: 750ml bottle, 13/3-2011, 38/100
Hazy hay colored body, nice thick white head. Excellent noble hop aroma, wheat, malt and yeast. Flavor has yeasty notes, floral hops, some honey and perfume. More subtle than aroma. Nice, but thin.
750ml bottle from boutip shared with jsprime. amazingly drinkable light and playful complex sessionable hoppy belgian pale ale. this beer sums up what belgian session beer is all about. great stuff!

Brought back from Belgian, shared with Hansi.
Hazy yellow with a sparkling white head. Deep complex yeast aroma, with sweet fruity notes of orange and citrus, herbs and spices. Very nice. Fresh and mild bitter flavor again with a nice yeasty sweetness. Great beer.
Una grandissima birra, bilanciata perfettamente. Amara ma nel giusto, beverina alla follia. Secondo me il prodotto migliore della Rulles.

750 ml bottle from Bieropholie, served cool in a tulip glass. BB June 2011.
App.:  Hazy golden with a large, fluffy white head.
  
Aroma:  Beautiful hop notes!  Citrus, resin, dank, a little dusty, Sauvignon Blanc, peppery, with sufficient bread/biscuit malt backing, some light yeast notes and esters, a bit floral, nice.
  
Palate:  Medium-ish body, nearly absent carbonation/effervescence...disappointing!
  
Flav.:  Lemon/citrus, dank, still reasonably resinous, some peppery pine, wheat, biscuit, bread crust, a touch of cardboard, honey, light esters and yeast notes, a little dusty and floral; dry with nice bitterness and a estery, malty finish.  The bitterness lingers nicely.

The palate was an odd and unexpected disappointment.  Otherwise, a beautiful hopped-up Belgian...YUM!
Bottle. Somewhat hazy yellow color, rich lasting white head. Fruity citrus aroma, spicy notes, grass and some apples. Fruity grassy flavor, spicy, dry hoppy, pepper and grapefruit notes.

Bottle.  Nice saison-ish Belgian.  Aroma had some citric hops and nice fruity/earthy Belgian yeast notes - apricots, peaches, light malt.  Some band-aid notes comes out, particularly in the taste, and it seemed to clash a bit with the beers light fruitiness.  The taste starts pretty dry and yeasty, but the finish was a bit sweet with some caramel/band-aid flavor - not great.  Otherwise, the beer has a fairly light mouthfeel and sits easily on the palate.  Medium gold liquid with a puffy white head and good lacing.  It wasnt a bad beer, but I was hoping for a bit more.

From Salling, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 150111.
Amber with white head. Aroma of malt and yeast. Flavor with fruity notes and spices.

8th March 2009 Cloudy gold beer, good white head. Smooth but very dry palate.Creamy malt with a light touch of spice. Watery grapefruit coming through in the dry finish. Not the best from this reliable brewery. Not terrible though!
Draft at Delirium Cafe, recommended by the bar tender.  Nice hazy golden pour, rocky white head.  Rustic grainy malts, bread, citrus, and grassy hops. Refreshing!  Solid beer.
Even if it is mostly for the summer season, I prefer the triple version. Despite that, its all in all pleasant, refreshing and well balanced. The carbonation is soft, light body and white head.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2011 In degustazione al locale del Polli a Milano, molto molto buona, si sente molto lamarillo. Ribevuta allOConnor in fusto, fantastica.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a creamy white head. The aroma is fruity, and quite hoppy with some spicy notes. Quite dry flavour of citric hops, spices, oranges and fresh fruit. Dry finish.

Recommended by the bartender at Delirium Cafe on 12-09-10 (3,40 euro). Hazy blonde/yellow color with a thin head. Definite sweet citrus/grapefruit notes in the nose and pallet. Smooth and a bit dry but finished nice. Overall solid beer.

750 ml bottle; clear light orange with thin, bubbly white head; light whit sugar, candy syrup, stale lemony malt, dry grain and light lemon; very thin texture with a koolaid fruity juice kind of feel to it; has that generic dry belgian mouthfeel and almost metallic flavor from the water; light dry bread and lemons with stale malt, grass, dried fruit; quite thin and less than memorable level of complexity or depth: thin, light fruit juice with stale yeast and bread; I hold belgian brewers in high regard, but this one is quite weak

Assaggiata in bottiglia da 75 cl.
Ottimo aspetto dorato e schiuma vaporosa. Aroma eccezionale con i luppoli e il miele che si mescolano delicatamente. Al palato il gusto è pieno, e il miele e gli aromi restavano equilibrati. Piacevolissimo anche il finale, veramente prolungato.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at Gallows Bird, Espoo) This bottle was too old even though it was not past its expiration date. The beer poured pale golden and almost clear. Its head was medium sized, white and long lasting. Aroma had fruitiness, Belgian style yeast, hint of hops and carboard. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. The age was noticeable in the taste. The flavours I found were carboard, mild sweetness, Belgian style yeast, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter. Clearly this beer is not for aging. I wish to be able to taste a fresher version of this beer later.

bottle from ølbutikken
clear yellow, large smooth creamy white head.
dry and flowery hoppy aroma. Very hoppy for a belgian ale. Great. very refreshing.
Flavor is also very hoppy for a belgian beer.. dry hoppy, flowery hoppy. good bitterness, some malty sweetness, but not much. Great refreshing summer beer. So good it works even now, sitting inside late november with frost and a few inches snow outside.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. 
Aroma: The nose has a bit of grain, cereals, grass, and light honey dew notes. 
Appearance: It pours a light greenish yellow with a tall, foamy, white head.  Great head retention and lacing. 
Taste: It contains a good bit of grassiness, a light floral side, and a bit of graininess.  The yeast plays a very subtle role here, which is a nice switch from the usual Belgian fare. 
Palate: Light in body with lots of soft carbonation leading to a rather dry and airy finish.  Very nice. 
Overall: A great lighter example of a Belgian ale that provides a nice use of hops.  Recommended.

Fin syrlighet och trevliga inslag av gräs, humle och grönt (äpplen, lime, päron.. nåt åt det hållet). En ganska frisk och mycket lätt öl som blev kvällens matöl. Kan absolut rekommenderas till för, under och efter grillning.

Bottle from systembolaget. It poured a hazy golden liquid with a medium sized fluffy white head that lasted a long time. Flavour of yeast, bread, fruits, esters and with a btiter finish. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium thick body and medium amount of carbonation. Nice and easy to drink summer beer, felt refreshing.

On draft at Monks Cafe in Philly.  Clear milky yellow pour with good white head ring.  Bready, dry belgian ipa qualties.  Bitter dry finish.  Not all that great imo, and not really worth the price.  meh.
Draught. Murky golden tasty.. Medium sweetness with ample yeast spices and a little bit of corriander. Refreshing with a solid creamy mouthfeel. A complex and tasty variant of the Rulles. Great brew.

Bottle at Monks.  Recommend by the owner.  Not sure what all the hype is. This beer is nothing crazy... tastes like your run of the mill homebrew.  Does use Orval yeast strain. Aside from that boring, dont waste your time.

A: The pour is a hazy pale straw color with a dense white head.

S: This beer smells like weed; no doubt about it. A strange floral note along with some rubber and sneakers?

T: The flavor is full of weed too, or what I would imagine it would taste like if you just ate a bunch by itself. Lightly bitter too, but not much depth of flavor.

M: The body is medium and so is the carbonation.

D: I suppose if youre a big marijuana fan, this beer might be for you. Otherwise, not all that enjoyable.
Draft at Pizzeria Paradiso.  Cloudy yellow, very refreshing, slightly sour with hints of white pepper.  Highly recommended.

Draught at Delerium Café. Lovely hop aroma, grass and pine. Pale gold, cloudy, with a tight, fine head. Glowing. Dry, hoppy, lovely flavor with citrus and grass and a bit of honey. Light and crisp. Great stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 Aroma is yeast, coriander and some hops. Taste is low on carbonation, thick, and pretty moderate version of aroma. Really high in drinkability, well balanced, but nothing special.

Flaske: Flot rødgullig øl med et dejligt tæt skumhoved. Duften er let humlet men med en let metallisk gærduft. Nydelig Smag af pilsnermalt og igen den fint balancerende metalliske gærsmag. Klassisk belgisk, klassisk godt.

Hummel cirton frisk lidt skum gylden uklar bitter lang liv fyldig 
 fad 26/7 delirium

Quite liked this one, good flavour and hoppy notes with malts, decent appearance, good drinking beer and not too strong so you can "go the distance" per se! One of the better lighter coloured Belgian blondes Ive tried.
Pours a cloudy yellowish orange with big white foamy head. Nose and taste of banana, clove, yeast and farmhouse funk.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 A cloudy, light yellow beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma is very refreshning, fruits, lime, tropical fruits, some spicyness and grass, fructose sweetness and earthyness. Taste of fruits, citrusfruits, some grass and sourness, nicely long and dry, herbal and citrusfruity sour aftertaste. Quite light to drink, but it fitts nicely into this beer; pleasant to drink. Fresh, tastefull, complex and interesting beer.
Light sweet wheat aroma with a deep golden color and decent small white head. The flavor and body are light with slight bitter notes that linger on the palate.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Citrus hops on the nose with Belgian spiciness.  Pours hazy golden blonde with a thick dense white head.  Hoppy upfront, very bitter with Belgian yeast spiciness with sweet grass and hey, very earthy bitterness.  Excellent!
Pours gold with white head.  Aroma is spices, citrus and dough/yeast.  Taste is doughy with the citrus adding some sweetness.  This was very similar to a saison and I very much enjoyed.

On tap at Monks. Hazy yellow-gold with a bubbly, thin white ring. Subtle, slightly dirty nose of soapy hop bitterness, lemon, creamy yeast, and light pepper. Flavor is less watery, more lemon, grass, biscuit, pepper. This all moves into a hoppy finish that is bone dry yet refreshing and intriguing. Beautiful blend, fantastic carbonation, and the finish lasting quite a while. As dry of a beer as Ive had, and damn good.

On tap at Monks.  Pours a hazy golden brown color with a decent off-white head.  Has a clean citrusy aroma.  A sweet brew with a nice spiciness, some lemon zest.  Some subtle bitters.  A nice creamy brew.

Had on draft at Capones

A-pours a golden straw yellow color with a nice haze to it and some sediment floating around.  the head is creamy, dense and pure white.

S-great nose, belgian yeast typical of the Orval, notes of lemon, a nice peppery spice.  hops kick in, floral and grassy hops in the back.

T-great complexity in this one with a fantastic balance.  the Duval yeast makes its presence know adding an earthy spice to it, a musky cellar funk behind, lemon, peppery spice tickles the back of the tongue.  hops take over in the finish, grassy herbal hops and a very light bitterness.

M-smooth but a little rough around the edges on the feel, light body but in no way thin, strong carbonation with a crisp dry finish that continues to dry out the mouth.

D-this has huge complexity to it and everything is well integrated.  The earthy spicy yeast and the cellar musky funk play off of each other and more grassy floral hops all seem to play under the same them.  very well done, what a gem!

Pours a hazy brown body with a big off-white head. Nose is mild, with pilsner malts and some fruity hops. Taste is bitter herbal and slightly fruity hops; hints of raspberry and spruce. Some yeastiness as well. Fresh and drinkable, but not too exiting.
Bottle:Pours hazy brownish yellow with a dense head. Fruity apple and citrus aroma. Flavour is fruity citrus, hops and loads of lemon zest. Very refreshing and easy drinking.
Una sorpresa. De graduació més baixa que la triple, també molt bona, ideal per lestiu. Fresqueta, amarga, equilibrada.
Sorprenent i refrescant, molt amarga i no tant contundent com altres belgues. La triple de Rulles també està molt bé.

75cl Bottle enjoyed in the park. Hazy golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of bready and a bit dusty malts, lots of hops, a bit of yeast, not unlike XX Bitter. Flavour is very malty, bready, a bit chalky, very good hoppy bitterness, bitter hoppy and yeasty finish. Light to medium bodied. Very tasty beer.

Hazy orange with a thick foamy white head.  Smells of dried apricots.  Taste is highly drinkable and deliciously hoppy and bitter.  Lightly sweet. La Rulles Estivale is a well crafted Belgian Ale.  Highly Recommended.

20100702  750ml bottle, recent batch, from State Line.  Medium golden with lasting, rocky white head.  Aroma is hoppy and fresh with soft citrus notes and a mild spiciness from the yeast.  Beautifully balanced beer, remarkably subdued extremities yet flavorful throughout and so refreshing.  Its impossible to not practically chug the whole 750ml, so quaffable and quenching.  Light bodied but with even, fine, refreshing carbonation and just right bitterness without being too aggressively bitter or pithy.  Lingering lemongrass and slight cilantro.  I love this beer.  Glad I checked because this is my last bottle and I was surprised to see Id never rated it.

Bottle. Cloudy golden/pale orange colour with a white head. Aroma: belgian spicy yeast, oranges, biscuity malt, whipped cream, light cardboard. Flavor: spicy yeast, lemon, bitter oranges, biscuity/bready malt, herbs, grassy medium bitterfinish. Better than expected.
On tap at Delirium cafe. Gold body with tall head. Nose of hops. Taste also of hops, and quite bitter. Grapefruit quite prevalent. Quite nice really.

draft @ Delirium Café, Brussels.
golden blonde with a light haze, white head.
aroma, very nice fresh hops, floral nose, touch of citrus.
flavors, hints of Belgian yeast, fresh hops leaving a very clean fresh mouthfeel, plenty of citrus fruits without too much bitterness.
Light lingering spicy palate, fruity, grapefruit, possible grassy / yeasty notes.
Tasty and refreshing for the season.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy orange with a medium head.
Hoppy fruity aroma; passiofruits, pineapple.
Spicy yeastiness in the flavour. Tropical fruits. Medium hoppiness.

Bottle, 75cl - Hazy blond orange beer with a large head. Aroma is fruity with notes of spices, yeast and orange. Flavor is fruity with sourish notes of spices, yeast and orange peel. Nice, very nice for only being 5,2%.

Bottle, 2010-06-20, Göteborg
AR: wit, dry/sour no fruit notable
AP: mussed apple, 3 cm high honey white head
F. grapefruit, tropical fruits, alomond, honey
Organic head!

Gradevolissima,estiva,asciutta e rinfrescante.Bel colore dorato,schiuma fine e abbastanza persistente,dal colore bianco non molto ricca.Allaroma si sprigiona subito evidente la prevalenza luppolata dellinsieme a cui si aggiungono leggeri sentori fruttati e le note asciutte dei lieviti.Ha corpo leggero ma carattere deciso,lascia impresso il segnio di un gusto volutamente asciutto e dissetante,dominato dalle note del luppolo.

Bottled. Pours out in a hazy blond colour with a rich frothy snow white head. Rich aroma of yeast, herbs, wet grass, spices and biscuits. Medium-bodied with notes of spices, herbs, white pepper, bark and yeast. Solid body. Dryish medium-bitter finish of grassy and herbal hops.

Bottle. All Rulles beers seems to be highly drinkable. This was no exception. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Lots of (not so sour) citrus hops in aroma. Some vanilla aswell. Taste is all about tropical fruits. Citrus hops, mango and orange. The yeast is a little spicy. This beer reminds me of an easy to drink saison.

Bottle.

Pours light hazy brown with a firm head.

Aroma of hops, passion fruit and a little barnyard.

Slightly dry with hops, and fruit, mainly oranges.
Lightly sweet and citrusy.  Blond with a white head.  A light beer with a nice hop strength.  Very enjoyable.

Bottle from Systembolaget.  Light hazy amber color with a thick lovely bouncey head.  Not much aroma, mostly from the citrusy hops.  Taste is mainly american hops and fruit from the yeast, not much malt.  Its an american pale ale fermented with a belgian yeast. Nice, but not anything special.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2010 (Bottle) Pours hazy golden with a creamy head. The aroma is subtle with notes of bread, hay, crackers, citrus, lilac, lavender, grass and polkagris up front. Undertones of earthy vanilla, incense, pine oil, barn/old wood house, drywall, root vegetables, dew, flowers/summer meadow and cobwebs/mouldy basement/dust. Hints of spices and herbs like coriander and rosemary. Whisper of esters. The nose is very discreet yet complex. Makes me think about toasted bread with fruit marmalade. The bready note also blends well with the grassy profile. A light note of old bread dough is the only downside for me. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and light to medium acidic. Tones of grapefruit, grass, lilac, herbs and clean bready/hay-like malt alongside a light pine note on the finish. The mouthfeel has an enjoyable juicy and clean profile; the only letdown is the notable astringes from the hops. Citrus, bitter herbs, black tea and dry malt on the finish. Near medium bodied. I like!

Aroma is a good balance of herbs, yeast and sweet fruit.  Kudos for reining in the herbs, usually when herbal aromas like this are present theyre overbearing, but here theyre restrained and perfect.  Flavor has lots of bitter citrus peel, yeast, and some green herbs.  Finish has some nice bitter citrus peel and yeast.

Nice hazy orange yellow pour with a fluffy white head.  Nutty grain aroma.  Slight tartness.  Incredibly dry slightly tart, but clean malt aroma.  Cereal, slightly nutty and a touch of sourness.  Lots of bitter grassy hops to finish.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2010 Bottle. Pours a light, golden-yellow with a modest, white head. Nose of light malt, grass, some hints of fruit. Flavor is subdued, very little sweetness, mild bitterness, some yeast, some citrus. Light to medium in body, well carbonated. Finish is dry and lightly sweet. A pretty nice beer, highly drinkable with interesting notes. Update: Had some of this at a Block Party in Brooklyn and Im gonna bump the rating up .2. This is great stuff.

On draft at Delirium Cafe. Pale yellowin colour, with a bit of haze, and strong carbonation. Aromas are a bit yeasty, along with pale British malts, and grassy hops. Quite grassy in the mouth, along with notes of white grapefruit, and yeast. Dry, light bodied, and fairly bitter. The yeast is a nice rustic touch. This is a fantastic summertime session beer.

(Old BA rate - tap)
Light hazy yellow-orange color, poured with a thinner white head. Very light and almost escapes you, with citruis notes, spices, and a bit of yeastiness.Very much mirrors the aroma, but is a bit more muted here, which I found odd. Citruisy, light fruit, and yeastiness with a touch of malt presence. Thin and light, spritzy carbonation. Good given that the tastes werent the most interesting aspect of the brew. I can appreciate the nuance needed, and considered this brew very refreshing and light. Overall, I might have enjoyed this brew on a warmer day given its seasonality, but thought it was pretty good stuff.

Draught at ZBF 2010. 
Hazy golden colour, medium white head. Floral hop nose, grassy and herbal. Grassy hops dominate, its bitter, from start to finish. Really balanced. Theres grape and vanilla. Long flavlour with accompanying bitterness. Solid and tasty. A little rubber balloon from the hops.
Pours a hazy golden yellow color. Aromas of grainy malts, yeast, and a touch of hops. Flavor was kind of lemony and herbal with some sweetness.
tap at delerium ... golden yellow ... big white head ... bright sharp lemon hop nose ... soft yeasty lemon ... some lemon peel.
Bottle at St Neots Beer Festival 10, courtesy of the good people from alesbymail.com. Grapefruit hop aroma and slightly sour soapy taste, with a sharp hoppy finish. Quite good.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2010 Draught at ZBF 2010. Hazy golden, medium white head. Spicy and peppery with orange zest and floral hops. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation. Well balanced with a dry finish.

Bottle from alesbymail.com. Hazy orange/golden pour with a thick, creamy head. Aromas of tangerines, peaches, orange peel, grapefruit. Fresh citrus/summer fruits nose. Flavours of honey, citrus burst, tropical fruit, lemon peel, hops. Full on fruity mouthfeel. Finishes sharp, bitter and very refreshing. Nice.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2010 (draught) pours a hazy yellow colour with a creamy white head. aroma of floral hops, tropical and citrus fruits, light grainy pale malts. flavour is the same, very refreshing though slightly watery, could use some more body. medium carbonation with a bitter finish.

(bottle, 75cl) Hazy, deep golden colour with a short frothy tanned head. Sweet and slightly cara-malty aroma with distinctively fruity and zesty hoppy notes of lemon, pineapples and some herbal accents. Bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied with a crispy mouthfeel. Moderately fruit-accented taste with a tinge of cara-malt and belgian yeast-character; pretty dry and bitter hoppy finish. Quaffable and a bit Saison-like brew. 03.II.10

Bottle: Golden, hazy, small firm white head, distinctive bitter-hoppy nose with a light fruity and yeasty background; solid dry bitter-sweet flavour, creamy MF, relatively light bodied; longering dry aromatic-hoppy finish. Fine hoppy brew.....
750 ml bottle a hazy light yellow colored beer with a white head aroma grassy hops and fruit like citrus taste citrus spices and a bitter hoppy finish

Bottle at home. Pours a clear golden color with a thick, foamy, white head that leaves some lacing. Hoppy aroma of grass and some citrus. Nice bitter, full flavor and with a creamy texture. Long bitter finish. Very drinkable.
dry malty,golden, clear, clear, minimal head, medium bitterness, very hoppy,light body, light body, light body, creamy, lively, lively, bitter. very good hoppy beer
Yellow and hazy, has a white head, lasting. Hoppy aroma, faint iron,  faint floral notes too. Flavor starts light sweet and finish heavy bitter. Dry, creamy texture.

Poured a hazy orange-yellow body with thick off-white head. Lots of yeasty esters and nice NW floral hops. Fruity, piny, mild on the tongue and very sessionable. Not overly complex, but quite interesting hybridization of styles
dajeeeeeeeee de estivaleeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!! litri e litri tutta la vitaaaaa!!! eheheheheh

75 cl bottle.Golden beer with nice foam head. Aroma contains malts, cloves and wets the taste buds. The taste starts of malty then finishes bitter with hops, hints of lemon skins. Very good session beer.

75cl Bottle, Carringtons, Chorlton. Poured a slightly hazy yellow colour with a good sized lingering white head. Aroma was musty yeast, with some fragrant hop, citrus and malt. Slid down super smoothly. Flavour was lightly sweet and had a really nice fresh zest to it . Really well balanced with plenty happening to tease the taste buds. Malt and hops well proportioned with a nice gentle spiciness.  Some bitterness in the finish. Enjoyable stuff.

Hmm. Somewhat interesting beer. Poured with a nice off white head and a little lace. Color is a very slightly hazy straw gold. Aroma is perfumy, peach, apricot, spice, hop, and malt. Flavors less interesting: it ok, a little bittersweet, a little hop and malt, a little tartness midway and tart/sweet finish. Body is good and so is carbonation. Alcohol is great and so is the rest of this beer for session.

Bottled 75cl. It pours a beautiful, murky orange beer with a nicely lacing white head. Leafy aroma of spring onion, a lot of yeast and american hops. Earthy, citrusy. Cat piss sneaking in. Interesting flavor. Beautiful lacework. Highly reminiscent of spring onion to my tastes! A lot of funky yeast appearing. Pineapple showing up. The intensity of the great hops clashes with the yeast profile in my opinion. Grassy.
Bottle.  Pours a golden orange body with a white head.  Fruity esters, citrus, pine, grapefruit.  Spicy hop resins, herbal with a dry hoppy finish.  Nice brew.
UPDATED: OCT 17, 2009 TAP: clear yellow/orange pour with some lacing. Not much nose, smooth but thin body, semi-bitter and a little flat tasting. Just okay.

Draught (Delirium, Brussels) - Golden in colour. Hoppy aroma with hints of grapefruit and a slightly spicy element. Delicious taste with lovely hoppy notes featuring tangy grapefruit and pineapple. The finish is hoppy and nicely balanced. Truly delicious.

Sampled @ Bieres et Saveur 09.09.07 : Dark Yellow, sparing head good lacing. This one is hazy. Light cereal is present, its citrusy its light in body and a bit acidic. Well balanced and easy drinking beer.

drank on tap at the beerpassion weekend at antwerp, that beer was one of the best of the festival (except one that i prefer, but its not the place to talk about other beers...). Fully hoppy beer with amarillos aromas, its like an american IPA, certainly great during the summer as it can fight all thirst we can have.

Draft at monks. Pours hazy gold with rthin white head, good lacing. Aroma of little citrus vanilla and bread. Tastes little sweet then a mild dry finish. Smooth with good carbonation and very drinkable.
Golden yellow hue with a fluffy white head. Pungent marajuana aroma and taste with a bright palate and an earthy finish with nectar notes.

On tap at Delirium Café, Brussels. Pours clear yellow with a medium head. Nose is spicy and there are some hints of banana and bubble gum. Quite malty. Taste is hoppy, citrusy and like aroma. A tiny bit watery but a nice beer to drink fresh on tap. Very drinkable and enjoyable.

750ml bottle courtesy of BOLT7555.  Thanks Jason!  Pours a hazy light gold with a 3 finger thick and stubborn snow white head that recedes to an iceberg floater and leaves spotty lacing.  The nose is spicy yeast, bready malt and citrus.  The taste is malt, peppery yeast, lemon zest, light earthy hops and just a touch of yeasty funk in the background at the end.  Mouthfeel is light and airy with a sharp dry finish on the palate.  Tasty beverage  thanks again J!

come poter passare un estate senza neanche un bicchiere di rulles Estival?
birra di un colore biondo paglierino e dalla schiuma bella compatta.
è una birra molto amara,ma al palato risulta una birra ben strutturata,e dal sapore molto luppolato,ma la cosa che mi ha stupito di più, è la persistenza dei suoi sentori molto floreali.

fairly cloudy gold, minimal white head.
fruity aroma -- mostly apple -- with a yeasty breadiness.
flavor is fruity with a bit of caramel and bitter (for a belgian) finish.
bodys a bit thin, but this was alright.
This blonde ale poured with a thin white head and an aroma of bread. There is a hearty caramel malt flavor with some serious hopping not common to Belgian ales. Some banana ester was also noted.

Draft at Nachbar. Frothy white head that slowly diminishes. The body is pale gold and hazy. Nice aroma of floral hops, grapefruit with notes of toasted malt and grain. Hint of dusty cobweb and laquer. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finished lightly sweet, moderately bitter and lightly acidic. Very dry. Medium body with a clean, fizzy texture from the carbonation. The more of this  I drank, the more I liked it  perhaps because the strong hop presence was a surprise for a Belgian pale ale. Refreshing, nicely bittered, clean mouthfeel. Very good especially on a hot summer evening.
Hazy light golden pour with a nice thin head.  Nose of sweet malts and hops.  Hops are in the flavor as well as sweet citrus.  A nice light summer Belgian Ale.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of light yeast, slight citrus, and some grains.  Poured amber/orange/apple juice in color with a large, rocky, creamy, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of small particles throughout.  Flavor is neither sweet nor bitter.  Tastes of dust, slight yeast, slight honey, light grains, and slight hops.  Flavor is incredibly bland and boring.  Light to medium body.  Thin, lightly chalky texture.  Average carbonation.  Grain and yeast finish is a bit chalky.  Like lightly flavored water.
Draft at Rustico in Alexandria VA. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small white head.  Aroma is pale malts and citrus hops.  Flavor is citrus, flowers, and a touch of sweet malts and spice.

draft at Delirium in Brussels - Pours hazy yellow with a one finger, fluffy head.  Theres a mild aroma of pale malt and hops.  The flavor is moderately hopped with notes of citrus and grass.  Its light to medium bodied with a crisp hop finish with lingering bitterness.  Very nice brew.

Maybe it takes an eclectic personality balanced by an open mind to appreciate and venture into the infinitely diverse world of beer, in light of both the good and the bad and anything in between. But then again, maybe not. No matter whom you are or what walk of life you come from, all it takes is an open mind and an open palate, something I would like to believe everyone is capable of. Those who are not I believe have made the choice not to be, and are thus doing themselves a disservice by not realizing their full potential.


A haze of soft golden hay topped by a cloud of white relaxes in my glass while gentle tendrils of lace make their mark. A few gentle swirls and a fresh burst of foam rises to the top, then settles once more into slumber while leaving more lacy trails. Right away, a wave of sharp acidity resembling cat pee and funk grabs my senses while lemon and spice sprinkled with peppercorn tickles the back of my nose. Sharp and piercing right off the bat, her nose settles into a soft bouquet of coriander, orange, and honey. Quite an interesting conflict of interests. Our first embrace is light with a wisp of a bitter, dry finish while soft floral esters permeate her palate. Creeping in with the dry bitter finish is delightfully biting sour funk slathered with a crisp lemon pucker. Further in, her body continues onto a fuller, chewier path while more citric skin lingers long into her finish. Is that a hint of juniper I detect mingling with her floral undertones? A very down-to-earth homely brew, I feel as if I am being embraced by the Mother herself, taking in all her aromatic and tactile splendor. A final flourish of sour funk finishes her off quite perfectly, in my opinion.


I had no idea what to expect going into my La Rulles Estivales Biere de Gamme, and what a deliciously exotic surprise she turned into. Officially categorized as a Belgian Ale, all I or anyone else really needs to know is that she was perfectly delicious. Styles are pertinent, yes, but only so far as being able to give your understanding of a beer and its palate a home. May I have another, please.

Bottled: Aroma is fruity and light hoppy. Light orange color, a lot of suspended sediment. Flavor is fruity, light malty, some citrus. Parfume, flowers, followed by bitter hops. Bit short end. Pleasant summer drink, refreshing, fruity sourly.

Bottle - 750ml. Hazy golden body with average carbonation and a thin white foamy/bubbly head. Nice malty/hoppy aroma with herbal and bready hints. Its sharp and fresh hoppy taste carries coriander notes and leaves a long bitter/herbal aftertaste. Nice summer ale!

Hazy blond/light orange color with a thin white head.  Aroma was a little spicy, a little malty, and had a good Belgian yeast kick.  A little citrus hop on the nose came more to the front on the flavor.  Still a little spicy, but much more hoppy in the mouth than on the nose.  A little bitter on the backend, but pretty smooth.  Interesting beer.

from crackedketle.com - cloudy dark orange colour with a persistent off-white foam; fresh and solid hoppy fruity aroma; yeasty and grapefruity; light to medium-bodied, quite tart and with a robust astringent bitterness; long bitter fruity finish - hoppy and refreshing: a beautiful one

14/03 0.75 l bottle shared with Doggythedog, from beershop.hr. It poured murky golden to orange body with some small yeast particles floating inside. Orange (Amarillo) hops aroma, fine but simple, having about nothing more here. Flavor is hoppy as well, citrus bitterish with some subtle vanilla malty and yeasty base. Well, its quite fine and pretty tasty for the ABV, although quite watery. Finish is longer, smooth although hops have their bite. Much more like an IPA than a Belgian ale, its an interesting and fine brew.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a fruity hoppy aroma a spicy fruity hoppy taste with a spicy bitter finish

draught at Zythos beerfest 2009, same hop as the struise mikkeller light beer with lots of character
Zythos 2009. Blond beer, very nice use of the Amarillo hops and resulting grapefuit aroma. Great bitter freshness.
Thanks to Smith4498 for the taste.  Pours a cloudy golden color.  Aroma is malty and Euro hops with a little dustiness.  Flavor is a little caramel, spices and some skunk.

(bottle) Pours hazy dark gold/murky orange with a small white head that sticks around and leaves good lacing. Pours hazy straw color with white head. Licrorice and malt aromas. Similar flavors with a dry finish. Medium body with average carbonation. Not as good as I was hoping.

Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry & garthicus -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a hazy orange-amber with some sediment and an average size diminishing frothy white head. Aromas fruity and yeasty along with spices and more hops then I expected. Flavour of yeast and grassy hops along with bready malt and a spicy finish. Average bodied. Just good.

Bottle (750ml).  Shared with blankboy and garthicus, by bottle via trade with boutip.  Cloudy amber pour, plenty of floaties, and a huge lasting whipped ice cream frothy head.  Slight lemon tartness to the arom, sweet malt and waves of spicy yeast, not too dry - some grassy bitterness in there too.  The taste was almost saison-like, pungently yeasty, quite grassy-bitter, not as tart as the aroma - had a very long spicy/yeasty finish.  Average at best body, very astringent indeed, slightly flat on the palate, but overall while maybe a bit of a senior citizen, quite good.

Brewed in Belgium......Pours a hazy golden color with a very foamy white head. Aroma of honey, erbs and yeast. The taste is of earth, grains and stale mustiness. The mouthfeel is boring and kind of lifeless !!! I was hoping for some peppery spices or something to give extra flavor.
Bottle shared by BeerGestapo, thanks Mike. Pours hazy gold with a large fluffy head. Both the nose and flavor scream honey. There is a touch of yeastiness to it as well. Simple but quite tasty.
Draft at den tatoverede enke. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are sugar, almonds, caramel and fruit.

Shared kindly by HogTownHarry with Blankboy and I. Appearance: Lovely proud white head, orange body with lots of flecks. Aroma: Perfume, spices, malt and hops, slight grass. Flavour: Big glass of fresh mown grass, hops, bitter and coriander, slight pepper too. Not bad at all
Yellow gold. Light head. Touch of banana in the nose. Dry and yeasty finish. Interesting, not as enjoyable as their tripel.

Bottle. Low but lasting fluffu white head. Hazy yellow body. Oranges coriander aroma. Heavy and dry fruity aroma. Flavor relatively citric orange grapefruit lemon with a dry and dusty edge. Hops bitterness on top of it. Low carbonation. Long bitter fruity afterester. Very interestomg amd hard to describe beer.

Bottled(750ml). -Cloudy pale golden coloured, medium sized white head, hoppy herbal nose. Very yeasty, bitter hoppy and light herbal taste with notes of carrot and spices. Pleasant strong bitter finish and aftertaste.

Pours a straw yellow with a 3/4" head. Nice lively carbonation rises as the head settles down a bit. Decent sticking. Peach and some citrus with a peppery spice in the nose. Very distinct odor of earthiness. Distinct flavor of straw and dry hop with sharp grainy spice with a mellow/subdued kick of orange rind in the after taste. Not as much fruit as I would have thought. Very light in body, smooth and clean. Very drinkable especially with a low ABV. This beer is refreshing and crisp.

75cl bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours hazy yellow with a lasting large white head & lacings. Nose is hoppy, grassy & yeasty. Medium bodied. Taste is dry with hints of fruit (orange), yeast & herbs/spices such as coriander. Ends dry & hoppy. Quite nice & crisp!

A huge bottle only, found at State Line Liquor. Pours a very light yellow with a good lasting head. Soft mouthfeel, a bit funky yeast comme une biere de garde, a bit musty yeast aroma. Very drinkable. Lower abv appreciated.A bit drying finish.Session Belgian.
Draught at Delirium, Brussels. Excellent condition - golden colour when pulled with a reasonable head. Orange, coriander perhaps even pepper aroma. Great hops, lasting flavour.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2009 750mL Bottle. Noses in a very cologne heavy sweet cool scent. Dew-like. Hop oriented, but well blended with yeast character. Pours a brassy golden with slight tinge and a head in rocky, well-lacing white. Flavor is rich. A fresh burst of rich, grassy-almost-piney hop character. Fresh and slightly tangy. Then a long sweep into a real quality Pilsener malt character. Its just so delicate. Great balanced. As the beer warms and breathes, it expresses more malt nuance and some delicate honey-like character that become real palpable in the finish. Delicious. Balanced, refreshing, complex and drinkable. All you can ask for in beer!

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Slightly hazy deep golden color with nice creamy head.  Perfumed, orangey, lemony, peppery and coriandery aroma. There is firm herbal hop flavor and firm bitterness with honeyish maltiness, pepper, coriander and clove in the background. Good robust flavor.

Courtesy of fishingnet.  Pours clear gold with thin white head. The aroma is crisp and fresh with a grainy maltiness, a citrus lemon bite along with raisins and prune notes. The taste is much the same starting with grainy malt notes and moving quickly toward tart citrus lemon acidity and countered by mild prune and raisin notes in the background. It ends with lingering citrus tartness.

Dusky gold color with a scant head.  Kind of shimmers in the glass, despite the low alcohol.  Spicy and malty as you would expect of a Belgian ale on the nose, but flavors are less complex and a little grainy.  Clean finish and aggressive hops to its credit.
Pours gold with a whice white head.  Smells of spice, dry malt.  tastes earthy with a nice dry malty finish.  Refreshing and crisp.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of sweet pale malt with citrus and floral hops and a touch of yeast. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium thin mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness. Good.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange, small, thin white head. Aroma is a sweet hoppiness, maybe some lemon and spice. Flavor is very pleasant hops, spice, light malt. Nice beer for a beautiful summer night.

On draught at Deep Ellum (Boston, MA). Pours a hazy golden color with a thick foamy white head that settles quickly but still laces the glass. Aroma is bready with notes of flowers, spice, and yeast. Flavor is sweet malt with some hoppy-bitterness, flowers, slight hoppy finish. Generally a light to medium body beer.

[Sampled on svogertour with Thomas and Troels at Mols.] A very nice unclear orangelooking beer with off white head. Yeasty sweeted aroma and flavor of spice, citrus, yeast and a hoppy finish. Great bikebeer!
On draft at Delirium, Brussels. An excellent, hoppy saison nose backing up a crisp, light body. Reminded me most of the saison from Pivovar Kocour Varnsdorf, in the very best way.
75cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, easy to drink, yet complex, hazy, good head, very good Summer brew

Draft at Monks....7/15/08....Cloudy golden body-off-white head.....aroma is faint sweet yeast..upon sitting aroma gains a little funk...in the mouth...a tart bitterness of yeasty proportions...a little metallic...finish is tart and dry...with a dry hop taste that lingers and lingers...a nice dainty lacing also

Very cloudy orange with some chunks. Doughy, bready, aroma with orange, straw, and nuts. A lot of the same in the flavor. Dry finish with light herbal hops. Simple little Belgian, but it hit the spot tonight.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2008 Fully clouded straw colored pour.  Punchy tang of pilsener malt aroma.  Grainy, honey glazed, candied almond and dough primaries.  A pleasant, floral-herbal framing dries it up a bit with a feathery, earthy touch that carries some lavender, musk and meadowy freshness.  Lovely.  
Spectacularly clean flavorsome body.  Vanilla dipped pears, bananas, and apricots sparkling in the chewiest, doughiest, softest gorgeous balance of malt.  Again, as in the aroma, the herbal and floral essences so fresh and pure tend to introduce a vibrant, glowing meadow-like freshness thats pretty breathtaking.  Rindy, zesty citrus touches provide a gritty edge.  Doughiness again at mid palate.  Smooth.  Crackery, bitter sesame seed really pushes the dusty blend of pils malt and warm yeasts. 
Yeast introduces an adhesive like element reminiscent of a the yeasty remnant of houbblon chouffe, but its better contained in this perfectly round construction of malt.  Hops still lively but calmed.
Light-medium body is taut and refreshing, though bolstered by an inarguable malty depth.  Dry, refreshing apricot sweetness in a long finish that layers an aromatic rosy essence that bitterly glows.  So fresh.

There are so many bottles of this gorgeous, belgianized pilsenerish refresher in the Twin Cities that have gone unpurchased, and if I had the money every last one would have a home.

Pours golden / orange with a dense soapy white head.  The aroma has light clean Belgium yeastiness, spice, fruitiness between citrus and nectar, coriander, pepper and more ~ interesting how complex the aroma is while it still seems light and crisp like a pils or kolsch.  Medium / light body thats crisp with a good amount of carbonation thats sharp and prickly.  The taste has the aroma traits with a sour funk that masks some of the aroma traits and it includes quite a bit of graininess as well.  The finish has grassiness from hops.  This is a nice beer that is very nice in the summer weather.  This is quite complex for the low abv and the amount of refreshment it give.

Pour is a bright gold with a large white head.  Aroma is decent with lots of yeast and spice.  Almost saisony.  Flavor is a bit weaker with some bready malts and a ok corriander citrus.  Nothing much to this one although it is kinda dull tasting but easy drinking and nothing offensive.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm) Cloudy yellow colour with frothy, white head.  Malty, grainy nose with generous amounts of grassy hops. Malty, grassy taste with notes of citrus (lemon), grain and serious doses of grassy, spicy, slightly citrussy hops in a bitter finish with an almost Dupontish touch. Medium body, really dry. Very nice and summery.

Fresh bottle.  This years batch.  Pale color with a small filmy foam.  Aroma is really subtle, maybe some lemon and a bit of Belgian character, but its a stretch.  Flavor opens up well, reveals some malt character, and a bit of hops.  The second year Ive had a bottle, and I dont understand the appeal.  Its ok, but nothing special.

Pours a bright hazy golden with a big fluffy white head that takes quite a while to dissipate and leaves a nice lacing.  Big floral and citrus hop smell with grass, oranges and grapefruit along with a nice spice kick as well.  Sweet, light bready malt aroma in the background which balanced out the bitterness of the hop smell.  Subtle hop bitterness up front but not over-the-top which gives way to a mild malty sweetness.  Touch of coriander and pepper spice up the taste a little before the slight lemony tart bitterness finishes the deal.  Mouthfeel is super crisp and clean and perfect for a warm spring evening.  Solid carbonation in there as well.  This is a supremely drinkable pale and perfectly refreshing on a hat afternoon.  Highly recommended.

750ml.  Hazy straw colored pour with a fine white head.  Slightly funky and yeasty aroma. Barnyardy saison type aroma with some extra spice.  Rounded hop profile.  Freshly cut grass.  Lemony mild citrus flavor.  Really smooth and fresh.  Light yeast and bread in the flavor.  Slightly chalky finish.  Id drink this around the BBQ or in the sun any day.

This gets points just for the funny label artwork.  This is a great hopped up saison.  Very yeasty, with some flavorful floral hop notes.  A hint of dried fruits lingers from time to time, but a slightly underwhelming malt backbone, but still ends up very dry on the finish.  An enjoyable seasonal.
Hazy golden with medium off white head. Sweet fruity aroma with yeasty and hoppy notes. Flavor likewise with a bitter end.
Alla spina al Klimos! Stratosferica e va giù veramente come lacqua fresca. Non ho voglia di scrivere, ho sonno

Bouteille verte de 750 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes et de coriandre. Apparence: La couleur est orangée voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes et de céréales avec une pointe dépices. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture crémeuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement astringent. (Rating #1633)

Aroma:good hopy aroma,grapefruit...
Appearance:light hazy gold,good lacing white head...
Flavor:good hopy falvor,grapefruit,critrus,light malt...taste like a ipa mixed with a saison...
Bottle: Poures a murky yellow with a white head. The aroma is strong hops with sweet fruit. The taste is highly carbonated with loads of nice hops and yet still a touch if fruit.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2016 Re-rate 2/16: Bottle sample at my (post-)10,000th rating celebration tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks Yoav. Belgian yeast, citric and spicy hops, some fruitiness. Nice. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

(3/2/08) Draught sample at Zythos Bier Festival 2008 in Sint Niklaas. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of hops, fruits and some yeast. Flavor starts really soft and a bit sweetish and continues to a bitter hoppy, slightly citrusy, finish. Medium-bodied. Fresh and very pleasant. 7/3/7/4/15=3.6

Appearance: Pours a pale, orange-heud body with a full, foamy white head.

Smell: Pilsner malts with a scent of wildflower honey, sliced peaches, and citrus. Slight note of fresh-ground pepper and bread.

Taste: Pilsner maltiness melds with a myriad of flavors, peach juice, lemon juce, spice, and honey. Never more than a mild sweetness. Floral, citrusy hop character with a growing grassiness and just enough bitterness to bring balance. Slightly musty yeast character. Crisp, drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. A little under moderate carbonation.

Drinkability: Immensely refreshing! A very well-made light Belgian ale with a delightful complexity. I made it through the 750ml bottle in record time.
750ml - Fizzy golden color, fleeting white head, faint dry hopped nose, not much there flavorwise, bitter finish.  Eeh.

2008-03-07. Hazy golden yellow with a nice white head. Served right frickin cold it takes me a while to warm it up. Pleasant lemon citrus in the flavour, muted underlying pale malt. (7+) Muted aroma, I can not tease much out of this. Light muddled citrus, dusty pale malt. (6+) Average plus palate. On tap at Delirium, Brussels

Draught (Delirium, Brussels)
Pale peachy colour, thin head. Coriander and citrus aroma, like a good wit. Big fruity peach taste, and very decent hopping. Refreshing and crisp. The words dont do this beer justice, but just note that 15 overall is generous for me, and well justified.

On tap at ZBF 08.  I was really lucky with my first few beers on day 2, beers that I really liked.  Hazy gold, lasting beige head  Really rather good.  Hop sting on end, soft in mouth, creamy.   Well balanced, drinkable, mid blond beer.

ZBF 2008: Hazy gold, with a good off-white head. Aromas of citrus, wheat, slight lactic sour, bubblegum and banana. Low earthy and grassy hops. Flavorwise there is first a quick shot of citrus followed by hops and then green wood. The hop character is strangely sweet. Then comes cane sugar before a more earthy hop character comes through. Those hops take you into the finish with some banana-bread.

750 pours out a hazed golden with a decent head that clings for a short time and spotty lace.  The aroma is yeasty, fresh bread, spice, lemon, and slightly floral hops.  The flavor is of light malt, some ale fruitiness as it warms, dry - however there is some sweetness that dances around, hops in the finish, and rather understated, but in a nice and refreshing way.  The palate is quite refreshing, fizzy, and clean.  Overall, this is quite the hot weather beer.  Not for the Minnesota winter, but still good.

Pours bright golden with a mostly maintained fluffly off-white head. Aroma is yeasty and herbal: notes of pear, peaches, bubble gum, lemongrass, and fruity hop resins. Taste is herbal, notes of chamomile, noble hops, pineapple and pear. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with lush carbonation. Very nice Belgian beer. I love the balance between the esters and the hops.

Poured a cloudy amber with a fizzy/frothy white head.  Light aroma of butter toffee, lemon, coriander, a bit of piney grassy hops.  Flavor follows with similar lightness with light toffee, a bit of grass, a dash of lemon, a bit of fruit and some light generic spiciness.  Body is soft and light.  Refreshing for sure, but I think it could have withstood a bit more complexity without sacrificing its refreshing character.

750 ml bottle. A cloudy orange beer with a medium sized and disappearing white head. Fesh hop nose with notes of flowers, grass and fruits. Some yeast and malt too. After smelling this, seems incredible this is made with American hops. The flavour confirms the expectations of the aroma, that is a hoppy beer, very flowery and grassy that seems to walk in a garden. Here the American hops are lightly more recognizable. Citric fruits notes. I agree that has some resemblances to a Saison. Light body, lively carnbonated, dry finish with medium bitterness. Very flavourful for such a low ABV and extremely drinkable. Refreshing and quenching, the ideal for Summer.
Bottle. Amber beer with an off-white head. yeasty, musty, earthy, hoppy aroma. yeasty, spicy, hoppy, slight bitter flavor. Medium body. Lingering spice and noble hops. Fairly dry. Slight tannins.

75 cL bottle. Mild but sharp citrus hop aroma. Hazy orange tinged gold color with a lazy white head. Medium body with sharpish carbonation. The bitter builds in the mouth. Its really nice to drink.

Tap. Muddy pale brown body. White small head. Light sweet fruity aroma, a little sourish too. Fruity and bitter flavour. Feels very dry. A tad yeasty. Very good when you are thirsty. (Delirium Cafe, Brüssel, 15.12.07)

From a 750mL Bottle.  Generously shared by TAR.  Cloudy, golden straw colored pour with a large head of rocky white foam.  The nose is clean, yet complex, accentuated by a restrained, clean bready malt sweetness, herbal hop bitterness,  lemon zest, and mild black pepper spice.  Light melon fruits and fleshy pear yeast esters add further enjoyment and complexity.  Light bodied, softly carbonated mouthfeel with a supple, gentle texture.  A clean, bready malt sweetness starts out the flavors before developing some of the interesting light fruity and peppery yeast characters.  As it finishes, it develops a mild, drying tartness that transitions beautifully into a dry, bitter hop finish.  Light, clean, wonderfully complex, refreshingly drinkable brew.

750 ml bottle Appearance: Cloudy gold with a thin white head and some lacing. Aroma: Dry malt, dry hops, herbal and floral hops and subtle notes of mint. Flavor: Crisp malt, herbal hops, yeast and a long bitter aftertaste. Pretty dry overall. Palate. Medium to full body with a medium carbonation. Very drinkable.

Cloudy gold body with an eggshell white head. The aroma is grassy with some sweat sock funk. I smell a hint of clove with some black pepper. Taste is light honey with some pears and cinnamon. More clove character comes though in the finish. The body is nice and light and this has s clean finish. Nicely made.

Pours with an initially quite frothy, three-finger thick, pale off-white colored head that leaves some nice lacing on the sides of my tulip glass & even recedes with some structured peaking to it.  As I pour the brew a touch of light struck hop scent reaches my nose, nothing too bad & hopefully it will dissipate.  My hope is confirmed when I finally get to exploring the aroma of this brew; it has a solid grassiness to it (influenced by both hop and pale grains), a fruity citrus character (lychee, apricot, candied tangelo peel) and a nice pale grain driven character of biscuits, fresh crushed soda crackers and an appetizing bread-like aroma.  This has a really nice appetizing aroma; I really like the mix of the bread-like malt aromatics (the dominant note perhaps), grassy hop / grain notes and the soft, yet persistent super hop fruit character.

Light feeling as it hits the tongue & it has a nice, prickly, slight foamy carbonation to it.  Quite dry tasting, but just a touch of sweetness that seems to be accentuated by the fruity hop notes.  A nice, substantial pale malt character builds in intensity as it moves towards a dry, biscuit-like / soda cracker grain character that lingers on in the finish.  Oh yeah, it is pretty hoppy too.  A persistent, mouth coating bitterness is noticeable from the get go & it lingers on into a long, biting finish.  While quite dry, some of  the fruit / citrus notes characteristic of the American hops definitely still come through; flavors of kumquats, aromatic, dried apricots, piquant Curacao orange zest and tangelo peel are all noticeable.  There is also a grassy undercurrent that is accentuated by both the malt and hop usage.  The yeast character supplies a light tartness, some esters / phenolics that definitely accentuates the grassy notes in the beer, a sort of cotton-mouth thing ; really this seems like a nice rustic Saison-type yeast here, though at times it can be hard to pick it out.

This beer is very drinkable, the 750ml bottle just seems to be disappearing.  I could perhaps wish for a little more yeast complexity, but really the ample hop & great malt character wouldnt come through nearly as well.
Old rating off a pile of forgotten notes. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Light body, moderate carbonation. Taste is predominated by malt and hops. Crisp finish with an astringent aftertaste.

Hazy orange, moderate head, good lacing and retention. Aroma is fruity, from both hops and yeast. Citrusy, lemony, some spicing. Medium to light body, fairly refreshing. Looked better on paper though.

Bottle: Poured a hazy beige color ale with a large foamy off-white head with some good retention and some lacing. Aroma of dry Belgian malt with some dry hops taste is dominated by some dry malt base with some floral and grassy hops. Body is pretty full with some average carbonation. Overall, this is an interesting take on a very interesting beer (Orval) but I thought it was slightly too dry and missing some funk to be truly great.

Couleur pain, avec un voile moyen et un mince col qui persiste tou comme leffervescence.
Parfum houblonné, floral et dherbe coupée. Rappel beaucoup une bonne IPA, au nez comme au goût. Assez sucrée, avec une amertume musclée. 
Bouche ronde et crémeuse.
Cest une excellente bière.

Sample, at the Mondial de la bière, savoured June 2 2006; eye: straw, hazy, suspended matter, nice compact white head; nose: apple, citrus, yeast, fresh; mouth: sour, a little harsh, pepper from the alcohol, long finale where the pepper dominates, medium body, good carbonation

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, bue au Mondial de la bière, savourée le 2 juin 2006; oeil : paille, voilée, petites particules en suspension, belle mousse blanche compacte; nez : pomme, citron, levure, fraîche; bouche : surette, petite aigreur, poivre dalcool, longue finale où le poivre dalcool domine, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation

Keg. Fantastic golden with little white head. Obviously citric, due to Yakimas hops, grapefruity, balanced with a light bready note. Peculiar yeasty and bit spicy. Definitely one of the most refreshing beers ive ever had.  Balancing is a goal achieved by this brilliant brewery indeed.

Bottle from State Line.  Turbid dull gold pour with 2-finger off-white head.  Citric aroma, with bready pale malt, spicy florals, and some cobwebby yeast.  Tasted bready pale malty, with yeast notes, and some spicy florals.  Stayed rather dry, but the flavors never seemed to get exciting and the whole beer seemed somewhat blase, even while playing Hit Me With Your Best Shot on Guitar Hero 3.

Bottle purchased at Liquor Max in Loveland, CO.  Pours hazy orange with a small, frothy, white head, diminishing with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (grain, hay, straw), average hops (flowers, grass), average yeast (barnyard, earth) with notes of green apples.  Light bodied, alcoholic texture, average carbonation, and a metallic finish.  Average duration, light sweetness, moderate acidity and bitterness.

750ml bottle. Served in my NB snifter. Really complex aromas of light earthines and barnyard, citrus and floral. Hazy gold color with visible sediment. Taste is sweet malt, black pepper, citrus & spice. Very gentle taste, despite the complex flavors. Nice mouthfeel. Very refreshing.

GABF post party.  The beer pours to a really murky pale yellow body with a thin white head.  The aroma is very floral, perfume, sweet grains, and nice basement biere de garde like.  The flavor is dry, yeasty, basement, floral perfume.  The palate is dry, light, refreshing, bitter, and very nice for a lighter beer.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2009 750mL bottle, courtesy of argo0. Hazy pale body with a small white head. The nose cookie dough, spicy herbal hops and light golden fruits. The flavor is bread, honey, cloves, peach and floral hops. Medium body is very soft with moderate carbonation.

Pours very pale and cloudy with a small white head. Very thin on the palate, dry, but lower carbonation, so the crispness lacked a bit and it was as estery as I hoped. Yeast character gave an interesting earthy mustiness/leathery quality to it, which now that I read the description I find in Orval as well. The hops felt like they overpowered the beer a bit since it was so thin and flat on the palate. Id like a bit more carbonation.

The aroma was spicy and citrusy with a nice caramel complement and a bready character. Citrus and spice worked very well together in an orange and pepper collusion. The beer poured with a very light haze and a persistent white frothy head. The flavor was light with citrus being a bit earthy and muted and with a decent level of bitterness. The flavor was muted caramel and light pepper character. The earthiness was well done and the pepper added another dimension to the flavor that was nice. The finish was dry with lasting pepper and light caramel into the aftertaste. No alcohol presence at all. The body was medium with a moderate level of carbonation and a crispness on the palate. A nice refreshing brew, not overly complex, but certainly not boring. 750 ml bottle. $7.99 at State Line in MD.
user_location: North of Raleigh, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: FEB 7, 2008 Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, white, fully lasting. Body is hazy medium yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs, grapefruit), lightly yeasty (cobwebs, basement), with notes of lemon zest, pepper, Juicy Fruit gum, honey. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation. Lots to like about this one. Fresh, bright lemony-flowery nose, excellent flavor balance (very dry, with just enough malt to keep it from being stark and thin), fluffy mouth-filling texture. It positively dances on the tongue. I can hardly stop quaffing the damned thing to rate it. This is quite saison-like to me, but no matter what you call it, this is an awesome beer.

2007 750mL bottle freshly imported in to the States, drunk all to myself on 9/26/07Gently-hazed, perfectly bottle conditioned appearance, with a lemon-lime tinted golden body and a large, rocky, white head that shows plentiful lacing.Wonderfully invigorating and refreshing hops in the nose still leave room to catch the clean, but very aromatic Orval yeast esters.  The hops burst all over the nose, some shooting straight up the sinuses in a perky citric fashion (tangerines, mainly), and others supporting the aroma in a more juicy, lush way (peaches, pears, nectarines).  Ample bitterness, as well, but its not too much, of course.  And of course, the malt...It backs the hops well, adding fair amounts of telltale pils malt honey and vanilla notes, but allows itself to be lessened in importance by the aforementioned bitterness and additional peppery hop notes.  High strength, very lasting.  No flaws, of course.The flavor dosent disappoint, in the least, with a stronger showing from the malt, leaving some sticky honey and cookie suggestions to be (mostly) dispersed by grassy and fruity hop notes (tangerine, apple, lilac, lemon zest).  Very supple malt body, with tight, engaging carbonation.  Some light cracker-like malt notes interrupt the softness of the texture, and on the end, some excess honey sweetness seems to build up ever so slightly along with lots of grassiness.  Minor, minor complaints and had I not had a near perfect bottle of Taras Boulba the next night, I would have hardly said a word.  Still world class, but I prefer the bone-dryness and singular peppery hop character of Taras to this one, which might have a touch of excess hop bitterness on account of its use of American hops.A side-by-side with Taras is, of course, in order.

Draft sampled. Pours a cloudy golden color with a off-white head. Aroma of citrus, light spices, pine, and notes of toasted grain. Flavor is very mild with light fruit, malts, yeast with a dry finish.
on tap @ Delirium Cafe in brussels. Very good beer. Light hop bitterness, slighly earthy, orange marmalade. Sweet & slightly bitterdry finish.
Draught at Ølbaren. Cloudy yellow - white head. Grainy, light flowery, honey, nice medium hoppy, grassy, light metallic (iron). An OK beer.
Draught. Pours hazy orange. Lovely fruity bit sweet and spiced aroma. Soft fresh, fruity, bit spiced hoppy flavour. Long dry finish. Good brew.
(750ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of orange, potent florals, citrus, oregano, and some grass.  Flavor of citrus, spicy yeast, clove, and floral hops.
Opque and yeasty.  A nice light yellow color .  Herb flavors. A Rather dry beer.

on tap @ delirum cafe, brussels. pours cloudy golden with white head. nose is spicy, flowery, berries, pretty hoppy too. flavor is hoppy, spicy, and lightly fruity, yeasty. fresh, clean, and very refreshing. really drinkable and nice.

Date: 07/02/2007
Mode: Draft
Source: Brick Store Pub

hazy yellow, dense white head, lots of drippy lace, 
sweet citrus and spice aroma, 
lots of spicy flavor, the spices blend well into a hop flavor that leads to a long bitter finish, touch of sweetness along with a citrus character, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
