Pours a hazy gold into a tulip.  Caramel, fruit and pine aromas.  Smooth with upfront earthly caramel and Orval yeast.  Dry, medium bitter hop finish.  Quite nice.
Hazy yellow of color woth a white head. An aroma of citrus, bitter noes, corianders, notes of eraser and wheat. A flavor of bitterness, coriander, spice and dry finish.

Deep amber/golden beer with a bit of haze and a thinnish head.  Very herbal/grassy aroma.  It is very fragrant, but in a dank rustic sort of way that I dont really care for all that much.  Wet vegetal aroma over what appears to be  an interesting yeast.  Some lemony citrus and soft spiciness.  Earthy and very dry with a long lingering grassiness.  Its got some things I like, but overall it doesnt really do it for me.

The aroma reminds of the incense smells I get when I walk into the stores at the mall. at bit plastic too. the flavor is very mild and very dry. the carbonation is very mellow. not quite what Im looking for.

The aroma is a little plastic but it does have some citrus hops and corn like malt. The appearance is hazy dark gold. The flavor is bitter and dry but a lot like the aroma. The palate is typical for the style. Overall pretty darn good.

Bottle... Hazy yellow ale with a mid-sized, wispy, white head. Incredible creamy retention. Phenolic, estery nose of clove, pear, barely toasted grain and stale American hops. A flavor full of subtleties; this one offers white pepper, clove, dried flowers, herbal-earthy hops, moderate bitterness and pilsener malt. Medium-bodied with lively carbonation. Lengthy, crisp then bitter, dry finish.
Clear golden amber body with a medium creamy white head. Sweet sugary fruity aroma with light breadiness. Sweet sugary flavor with light caramel in the background.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2009 2007-09-14, draught at Plan B, Copenhagen, 8-5-7-3-15=38Cloudy blond color, wonderful creamy and rocky head. Sweet, floral aroma, a bit fruity. Medium body, some malt flavor, hay, residual sweetness, floral, quite high bitterness. Refreshing.2007-07-31, draught at Delirium Café, Bruxelles, 8-4-8-5-17=42Cloudy blond color. The aroma is very flowery, with perfumy citrus fruits too. Not too strong, but the mouthfeel is good, with an excellent flavor of malt, spices and flowers (elderflowers and orange blossom), and a pleasant strong ending bitterness, still with orange zest and flowers. Lovely.

Van tvat in the Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Zesty, grapefruity, generously-hopped refresher with a herbal pepperiness and a punchy citrus bite. Witbier haze heaped with creamy suds. Juicily hopped Belgian sessions.

750mL bottle, courtesy of argo0.  Thanks, Aaron!  Pours a cloudy, yellowish-amber color; white head with fine-bubbled lacing.  Peppery, yeasty and floral aroma; dense, layered.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: yeast and white pepper notes; slightly dry, with a dense estery presence; some vanilla.  Medium, yeasty and pepper finish.
Tasted 2007-05-12. It tastes sorta like a weisse. It smells sorta like a weisse. Its not a weisse. There are lotsa cloves and banana in there. its a very sweet beer!

Bottle, courtesy of argo0. Slightly cloudy with some floating particles and a white head. Light, herbal perfumey nose. Flavor starts off with notes of pale grain, grassiness, hay and plenty of (what tastes like) noble hop bitterness but the commercial description says Warrior and Amarillo (?). Ends dry. Kind of like a saison but with a less interesting yeast (but, per the commercial description it uses Orvals?). Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation. Nice beer overall.

Draft. Medium sized white head, fluffy, good retention and nice lacing. Hazy light gold color. Nose is light fruit, light spices, lightly vegetal. Light bodied with a soft carbonation. Light fruity flavors, citrusy, dry maltiness, lightly bready, doughy and a touch peppery. Dry finish with a crisp hoppiness.
(750ml bottle) Small off-white head atop cloudy golden body.  Aroma is mild, medium sweet, dusky, herbal/lemon.  Taste is medium sweet, herbal, some grassy, orange/lemon.  Light-medium body, dusky.

Bottle @ Kens Walloping Wednesday - Soft hazy gold, creamy white head.  Complex powdery citrus nose that sits on vanilla dough and grassy honey tones.  Fruity citric hops flavors mingle well with the soft yeast and lemony vanilla notes.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, drying bitter finish.  A great summer brew in my book.  Thanks for sharing Aaron

Pours a slightly hazy golden bronze with a well-lacing frothy white head.  Dry, earthy grassy nose has some pale malt and mild biscuity character along with a good dose of hops.  Body starts very dry and earthy with a lot of bitterness and floral, grassy flavor with some notes of toasted malt.  Needs a little more sweetness to balance the bitterness, but otherwise a decent spring ale.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2007 Cloudy orange body with soft yellow hues, sediment stirring within. Pretty lacing is imparted by a mostly diminishing white head, very creamy while it lasts. The nose is lightly sweet and very yeasty. Each inhalation has loads of grassy hops at its core. Notes of lemon, honeydew melon, vanilla, orange peel and coriander all linger above the spicy yeastiness. toasted grains are plentiful and buttery. The aroma is rounded out by pepper and alcohol notes. The flavor is nicely balanced, medium levels of sweetness pair nicely with ample hoppy bitterness. Acidity is high but complimentary. Lemon and coriander notes still succeed in arriving ahead of copious yeast. The ethanol notes in the flavor are very spicy. Peppery tasting yeast only adds to this conundrum. Finishes exceedingly warming, quite bitter and moderately acidic, lemon and grain notes lingering briefly before succumbing to the final wave very spicy yeastiness. The mouthfeel is light-medium bodied, softly though vigorously carbonated, balanced and pleasant. Alcohol warming is very potent though, for such a low alcohol beer, and detracts from what would otherwise be a sessionable belgian ale.

Pours a hazy glowing gold color with a medium, well-retained white head.  Alot going on in the aroma.  Huge spice aroma, nutmeg, coriander, caramel, a little cinnamon, and some citrus fruit all mixed into one.  Smells really good.  The taste is very much like the smell.  Big spice all the way through.  Alot of coriander, and orange citrus jump out at me right away.  Some of the nutmeg I smelled shows up, but it is more subdued than in the aroma.  Body was thinner than Id hoped for, but didnt take away from it too much.  The spicy bitterness is left on the palate in the aftertaste.  Almost a pepperyness to it shows up too.  Very interesting beer, and pretty good.

Hazy golden body with a thin and fleeting white head.  Very yeasty and spicy aroma with touches of citrus zest.  Light bodied with ample carbonation.  Pungent mouthfeel.  Very tart/sour taste.  A good example of the style but not my style.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2009 Re-rate, draft at Half Moon, Sept 09 - Not much different than before, earthiness along with all the grass, etc... Snore. Draft: Deep golden-yellow in color, nice generous white head, solid lacing. The aroma was very pilsner like, pils malts noticeable first and foremost, grass, lemon grass, and bready aspects. The flavor was pils malts, fruity esters, lemon grass, grass, doughy malts, and funky yeast byproducts. Mouthfeel was full, the highpoint of the beer. While the complexity was there and I can see why others would appreciate this, it was a bit too unmelded for me, I didnt like the way the flavors came together, and Im not fond of the higher emphasis of pilsner-like qualities in my Belgian ales. to each his own.
UPDATED: APR 6, 2008 chiara fresca rinfrescante lievemente acidula poco corpo ed un finale deciso di luppoli americani
25.4 oz bottle.  Cloudy cream soda with a snow white head.  Dough, lemon, apricot and spice.  Taste is tart and sprucey with lemon peel tang.  Honey, grass and mild drying.  Soft carb, medium light.

Bottle, 75 cl; @ festival Hotton. Yellow-golden color with small white head. Aroma good hoppy with a citrustouch. Medium body.  Good full mouthfeel. Taste very bitter, refreshing on a summer day, floral notes. Very good beer !
Tried at SIB. Lots of yeast and a little sweet malt. Some hops, but not much. Reminded me a bit of flat apple juice.

Bottled. Hazy yellow colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is barnyard with some yeasty and fruity hints. Flavour is sour fruits, yeast and some hops. Quite ok brew, but I didnt get that excited about it.

Dark yellow colored, strongly cloudy appearance. Medium sized white head. Strongly hopped aroma, reminds me of Urguell-saaz... Lemon and fruits also there, still these hops are very dominating. Thin to medium bodied, rather watery palate. Flavor is also as hopped: lemon and mild yeast there too.

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2007 The aroma is quite hoppy with a lot of citrus, grass and musty herbal notes. Some mild spice notes are present as well. Smells a little saison-y. The body is a cloudy dull yellow and holds a lasting, frothy white head that starts about two fingers thick. Grainy/wheat accented fore quickly segues into pale crisp fruit notes with a hint of creme and vanilla. Floral and hay notes and mild citrus hints appear toward the finish. It hints at being sweet, but dries out before ever getting there.  Has a great mouth feel that leans toward being creamy, but it is light enough of body to still be quite refreshing. This is damn fine beer here.

750ml. bottle. Pale yellow color with a good sized white head. Musty, grassy aroma of pale malts, citrus hops and a bit of coriander. Flavor was surprisingly hoppy for a Belgian ale, but did not overpower the nice light pale malt taste. A bit grassy with a touch of musty barnyard notes. Really enjoyable and easy drinking.

750ml bottle poured into a Leffe glass.  Pours with a small but strong head that turns into a nicely strong lacing that covers the whole surface.  The color is a pale golden and very misty, allows a lot of light but only medium clarity.  Aroma is a great mix of different elements - pilsner maltiness, light citrus, light biscuit, crisp-floral - all equally meshed and not overpowering at all.  Taste is pilsner-floral and dare I say sunshine, just drinking this makes me think sunshine beer.  Its so easy drinking yet full of flavor.  At the end of the flavor is a great lightly bitter, lightly grassy/floral dryness that rounds it all of and makes you want more.  Its not sweet so it feels like you can drink this forever.  Feels so light, like I just had water, but in the good way. Highly recommended.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Tap @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Cph. Hazy and very pale yellow. A big bubbly white head. Aroma is sweet, with lots of grass, banana, wheat and flowery hops. A touch watery perhaps. Flavour reminds me slightly of a Saison mixed with a wit. Sweet and with a good bitterness at the end.

Bottled 75 cl
Hazy pale yellow color, small creamy white head. Strong cut grass (cat piss) aroma. Loads of hayish hops - malty backbone is a bit thin, but otherwise reasonably in balance. Saison-like. Beer is "a bit alcoholic Belgian farm ale meets American ale".

Bottled.  Cloudy pale yellow, rich airy head. Lemony orangey nose with a touch of vanilla. Grainy and flowery, medium sweet with notes of coriander. Much drier finish. Light, drinkable summer ale, yet with a fairly intense flavour.

cloudy gold pour with a medium sized creamy white head.  crisp, fresh pine, lemon, grass, pepper aroma.  very nice aroma.  flavor is mostly grapefruity hops but also has a nice bready, grainy malt in finish.  very fresh and clean palate.
Københavnske Øldage 07. Light straw/yellow with a fruity aroma with notes of yeast, barn and yeast. The flavour has notes of citrus, acidity, yeast, spices and a touch of honey. Not bad at all. 16/29

A very late entry, now that Ive finally figured out what beer it was that I had.  Hazy gold color with no head.  Spicy grass aroma.  The taste is very hoppy, especially for a Belgian ale at 35 IBU.  .  Dusty and dry.
On tap at Københavnske øldage 07. Yellow / golden colour with a white head. Aroma is yeast, citrus, fruit, grain. Flavour is yeast, citrus, dry, fruit, hop, spices, grain. Ordinary beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2007 (Bottled, 0.75l) Hazy golden with a smallish head. Herby-flowery-hoppy, dry aroma with wheaty maltiness. Freshly lavender-hoppy, a bit raw, saison-like flavor. Medium-bodied, crisp palate with foamy carbonation. Nice, if a bit unrefined. Deserves a re-taste.

Bottle sampled. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, spice, and herbalness. The flavor is citrus, spices, slight fruit, and a fair amount of hops giving way to a dry finish. Good brew.

On tap at Københavnske Øldage. A bit hazy, golden-yellow brew with a white head. Spiced, malty and grainy aroma and flavor, with some lime as well. Medium body. Grainy, lightly spiced and sour finish. I was really surprised with the score of this beer, as I found it dead boring for a belgian ale. Its not bad, just boring. (070512)
Gold blond coloured beer with almost no carbonation and an average white head. Very herby aroma, sweet yeasty touches. Full palate. Finish is herby, very special one.

Bottle. Pours hazy light gold with a tiny bright white head. Interesting nose: hoppy and yeasty dryness balanced nicely by some citrusy sweetness. Creamy on the palate. Not overly complex flavor profile: hints of spice, dry yeast and some lemony/orange peel sweetness. A bit floral. Finishes dry with a hint of lemon zest sourness.
Lots of hops in the aroma.  Flavor is surprisingly and disappointingly light.  A few spices, and fairly thirst quenching.  I thought it was a saison.  Cloudy gold color.  Very dry, organic finish.
Robe blonde claire surmontée dune mousse qui sestompe. Arômes de houblon et dépices. Saveurs de houblon aromatique épicé, de blé, de céréales et de levures.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2007 Initially I was bummed as this replaced the Houblon handle at Delirium.  But damn it was good.  Had two before trying other things.  It was hot and this was a perfect warm weather beer that quenched my thirst.  As I savored the moment the rest of the customers got ripped and jammed to the Belgian cover bands version of Killing In The Name.  The beer (and the song) was all the rage.
Bu au Mondial 07. Blonde claire, petit collet. Arome de malte bien épicé, avec un bon mélange de céréals intéressants. Goût dépice et dherbe raffréchissante, avec des houblons doux et plaisants.

On draught at Bier Circus, Brussels. Hazy golden colour- stable, thick white head. Spicy fruit aroma. Flavours are strongly spiced with even a hint of vegetables. Peppery. Body is medium to lightish. A quite refined beer.

Draught @ Københavnske Øldage 2007 in Copenhagen. Unclear dark yellow color with a average frothy fair lacing mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma is moderate hoppy, citrus, fruit, moderate yeasty, sour, honey. Initial flavor is moderate sweet, moderate acidic and light bitter, finish flavor is moderate sweet, light acidic, moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2009 Re-rating after multiple occasions, draft and bottle. Lovely bright golden color with nice white head... gorgeous. Begs to be quaffed. Aroma is quite hoppy, with floral and herbal impressions, plus a tinge of zest from the yeast. Enjoyable hop bitterness carried on lively carbonation, nice dry finish. Still begging. Perfectly quenching yet with great character. One of the best beers in Belgium, still flying somewhat under the radar.

Bottle. Small fizzy with head that mostly diminished. Clear pale yellow color. Yeast, citrus, spice, fruit, coriander and light floral notes. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Well balanced between the sweet fruity and bitter floral notes. Nice sweet spicy finish. For 5,2 % this is amazingly complex and thick in aroma and flavor.
Bottled a vere refreshing beer for the summer. Rich and fruity. Some seet touch and also a little bitter. A rather complex beer

Bottled. Trade with Otje - Cheers -  A hazy light amber coloured beer with a nice big fluffy white head.  Good spicy peppery aroma with typical Belgian Ale yeastiness.  Bittering hops are there too but you really have to inhale to find them.  The taste is bitter and hoppy but the palate is thin.  A little spiciness. OK but not all that.

At Delirium in Brussels-shared with bartender and a dude from England. Farmhouse summer ale with the funky nose of a saison. Yellow and not filtered with spicing throughout. Very refreshing and easy-drinking. Well done.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 bottle picked up at London Drinker. Opaque amber with the most fantastic head! Hops, orange zest and spice throughout. Some flowers in the aroma. Very light with a slight bitterness. Jsquire is right - there is hairspray in the finish! But its abrupt and is quickly replaced with spicey orange. More hoppy than I normally enjoy. Crisp and perfect for the summertime.

Frothy white head over a light golden beer.  Light floral aroma with some spice.  Sour orange flavors with some spice and hairspray in the finish.  Crisp summer drink, with a little soap and funk.  Thanks to papsoe for the bottle.

Bottle (from Bitter Virtue). Lovely initial hop aroma juicy orange peel and leafy notes. Earthy fruitiness underneath this, the malt body is reasonably firm and drinkably dry. Not overly bitter in the finish but with a long flavoursome hop finish with slight tartness like a chunky orange marmalade. Very drinkable, good stuff.

Bottle. Thanks for sharing jsquire. Small whit ehead that mostly diminished, fair amount of lacing, cloudy, visible carbonation, and a yellow gold hue. Nose was malty, hops, semi-sweet, yeast, and floral nose. Flavor was malty, somwhat sour, lightly bitter, and some spice. Fairly smooth mouthfeel. Medium body. Worthy of a try.

A Mes rate: 
75cl bottle shared with my other half, Duff and Nick. This was a very generous freebie from Mr. Vivi at Lowlander and jolly good it is too. Faintly zesty nose with something fizzy about it. Quite unusual but a little too mellow. Nice enough though. Great looks, its rare a blonde beer gets a 4 from me but this is a perfect colour and kept its  head all the way down. Fairly straight forward in the mouth but what it does it does very well indeed. Hoppy, citric, little bit of spice and some faint biscuit notes. Quite dry and smooth drinking. Downable and tasty is the most I can say really. Its just very very good at what it does. Yum!

75 cL bottle. Cloudy orange colour, white head. Nice smell of hops. Sweet with dry hoptaste following. Goes perfectly with barbeque. Complex yet simple. This is the beer that made me come back to La Rulles over and over again.

[Bottle at TNT pub in Bibbiano near Siena] Fresh flowery aroma, a bit spicy and "flemish", in the mouth it is tasteful and full but drinkable, with some very slightly sour notes and a nice hoppy bitter dryness that persists in the finish. Complex but at the same time "easy" and drinkable, a miracle!

Aroma of malts, orval-like yeast, hops. Cloudy, orange coloured with a medium, white head. Taste is sweet and more dry hopbitter in the end. Some caramel malts, some citric notes in the taste, but mainly hops and yeast. Orval style and a bit like the Bitter de Ranke. Quality ingredients and well balanced. Superb brew. Nice to there is another 75 cl bottle in my supply. :-)

Cloudy orange golden color, medium frothy white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, bit flowery, fruity, hoppy, some bubblegum, Orval-like. Orval is definitely the taste i think about when drinking this beer, dry and bitter, bit fruity and sweet. An Orval look-a-like, which almost reaches the quality of its example.

Doughy sweetness with leafy tobacco and floral lavender notes in the aroma.  Opaque yellow gold coloured body topped by a low bright white head that recedes to a lasting cover with some sudsy lacing.  Leafy hops and grainy malts in the flavour along with some woody character and moderate bitterness that is apparent from the start.  Medium light body is very dry with strong, lively carbonation.  Sampled at Mondial 2006.
Bottle at ZBF 06. Pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, spicy, lemon. Taste is malty and bitter. long bitter aftertaste

Draught. Light golden color with a full soft white head. Mild pale malts and full floral hops aromas. Some mild citrus and spice in the background. Full and soft feel. Pale malt meld with light spice and a hint of attic dust and yeast. LIght and refreshing brew that hit many flavors and doesnt get lost on the way.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2008 The pour reveals a cloudy golden color with a medium, frothy, white head. Very good aroma of hay, fruity hops and yeast, it feels very mellow and calm. The flavor is all about being mellow and smooth, theres a nice balance between the fruity hops, the yeast and the malt, theres also a mild tartness. The body is medium with a creamy texture and moderate carbonation. I love this beer.
Pour is opaque orangey yellow with a thin dense sticky white head...vanilla lavender, bananas, and yeast in the nose...nice sweet funky flavor up front with a yeasty bitter finish...nice.

Pinkish blonde color, hazy, almost cloudy. 75 cl bottle. Lots of grapefruit and flowery hops in the aroma. Very hoppy, flowery flavor. Grapefruit. Touch of vanilla and yeast. Almost medium bodied. Light on the tongue, but quite tasty and full of quality. Recommended, but a slight lack of balance prevents it from scoring even higher.
Light hazy golden colour with a white head. malty and sweet aroma with a grassy and vague fruity note. Hoppy flavor with a citric fruityness.

Sample from the bottle (750 ml ) at the Mondial de la Bière, 2006.  A small retained head tops the hazy, dense golden body which offers faint yeast swirls to the eye....grassy, herbal nose with hints of strange vegetables, though not in an "off" way -- wild leeks, perhaps and mustard greens.....a beautiful flavor profile full of both fresh grasses and old dry hay, faint oregano and thyme, honey sweetness builds but never dominates the spicy bitterness of hop and herb, orange interacts to add acidity....light, very fresh and clean with a muted yeast profile.   I wasnt as blown away by this as many, but it was certainly a fine summer outdoor session Belgian.
Bottle. Hazy golden with almost no head. Sweet and fruity and also a bit hoppy. Notes af yeast and different spices.
Bottle at Københavnske Øldage 2006. Golden clear colour with a nice creamy head. Lovely aroma of yeast, spices and coriander. Nice tasty flavour of coriander, spices and hints of yeast.
Draught. Golden colour with a small white head. perfumed, floral, citrus, hop aroma and taste, sweet. Medium body with a light dry finish.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2010 In short: A floral/perfumy juicy hoppy Saison-ish Belgian.  Very good.
How: Many times.  Most recently: many 750ml bottles (2007 batch) acquired through private importations, drank fresh within a few months.
The look: Cloudy golden-yellow body with a medium white head
In long: Very perfumy beer.  A lot of hops goes into this baby and its an unusual hop profile as far as Belgium beers and concerned.  Citrus, pineapples, lemongrass, marmalade and some dry grass noble hops make up the fruity hop flavour spectrum.  Very juicy with a lot of hops juice/essence (dry-hopping?).  A lick of vanilla and an a somewhat milky/ice-cream flavour that sticks to the back of the tongue.  Bubblegum yeasty notes.  Body is full but light with a perfect lively Belgian carbonation.  Very smooth and easy to drink but complex enough to satisfy the most demanding taste buds.  Too bad its only brewed once a year.  God, please give me patience and more Rulles Estivale, and give it to me now!!!

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 An angelic ring of foam hovers atop the sunny blond haze...Glittering citrus juices leak onto dry, bitter flower petals and pine needles...Complexity and drinkability dazzle, as plantane esters and haystack sizzle in the summer heat...This is as close as the Belgians can get to a Franconian Kellerbier...

Draught - Clear golden body, with white head; Deep complex very well balanced nose, it needs a little extra to really interesting: orange, apple together with a little yeast; Quite flat body a bit sour; Moves into a bitter dry finish with very little aroma: some orange peel, but actually mostly a bitter sourness.

75 cl bottle, bbe Feb 2009. Amber with a golden hue, turbid, moderately lacy head. Nose of yeast and citrus. Dry, fruity (pears, citrus) taste with a long hop bitter aftertaste. Rich mouthfeel. Very good, very saison-like.

Hazy yellow gold hue, with a an off-white head, yeasty bubblegun nose, with a spicy coriander and herbal notes, citrus fruits fruitiness, and pale malt aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty fruity character, good herbal and grassy notes, with a touch spiced coriander, hint of pale malt, leading towards a nice hop bittering finish.

(Bottle 75 cl) Pours pilsener golden with a slight haze and a creamy, white head leaving a neat lacework. Fresh, hoppy nose - has both citric and herbal accents. Fairly light-bodied with notes of pale malts and a lightly hoppy finish. A very pleasant, fresh and quenching brew. 200506

Draught.
Cloudy yellow coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of fruits and spices.
Flavour of fruits, spices, citrus and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

[Draft at Københavnske Øldage 2006] An unclear orange beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet and very yeasty, and the flavor is sweet yeasty with notes of spices and citrus on a malty background, the yeastyness lingers in the end. Nice - Ive been looking forward to this ever since I saw the ratings from ZBF and I was not disappointed.

Draught. Refreshing, fruity aroma. Slightly cloudy golden colour, almost no head. Nicely aroma hopped. Mild flavour with OK bitterness, citric, turning acidic. Yeasty aftertaste. Somehow reminds me of a British ale.

Sampled from draught at Zythos Beer Festival 2006.Clear golden colored, fluffy white head. Fresh hoppy and flowery aroma with a little yeast and grass. Dominating grassy flavor, dry and a bit biding with a sweet subnote. Dry bitter end. Good, but I have to say this beer is overrated imo, since it doesnt have anything that you cant find in many other Belgian ales.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2007 Re-rated bottle 07. Pours without any head. The flavors are pretty much the same with some grapes. 

Zythos 06. Light yellow with a corney aroma. The head is durable enough to last most of the way. Taste is more corn but bland hops and fresh grains dont do much to make this more than average at best.

Draft. Pours cloudy gold with a small white head. Nose is wheaty and citrusy with a nice yeast and light spice backbone. Taste seemed very wit-like to me. Wheat, yeast, citrus fruits (orange and lemon, mainly), flowers, spice, and light herbal notes. Body is light and refreshing. Mild carbonation feel to it. Finishes with some mild spice notes, wheat, yeast, flowers, candied orange and lemon zest. Perhaps a wit blended with a  Belgian Ale?
Draught at ZBF2006. Golden colour with a big off-white head. Sweet floral hoppy aroma. Flavor is fruity with hints of yeast and a nice hoppiness. Long nice bitter aftertaste.

Draught: Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Sweet and wheatish aroma with yeast, citrus and fruity notes. Flavour have loads of fruit, banana, yeast and a herbal hoppiness. Nice full body and mouthfeel. Has a light bitter fruity end. Definately a good one.
Honey everywhere. Then, grapefruit and orange peel everywhere. Then they mix with some great hops and viola: a winner. And lets not forget about the wonderful yeastiness throughout!

Huge, white head leaving coarse lace; deep copper body with ongoing carbonation. Deep aroma of citrusy hops (cascade?!?) and fruity yeast notes; also detectable are resin/pine notes. Bitter, malty taste with slightly oily mouthfeel. Grapefruity bitterness. Not much body. Vert good, but could do with more body. Quite refreshing. (Beginning to suspect that Biere de Garde and Saison are just not my beer styles.)

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2006 Tasted at Belgium Comes to Cooperstown, July 16, 2005. Hazy blonde with a creamy white head. Fresh hops in aroma with citrus and light coriander. Rich malt and wheat in mouth, with intense fresh hops and light grapefruits. A mix of belgian strong and IPA. Good medium bodied. 7-4-8-3-15  

Hazy blonde ale with a thick creamy white head. Floral hops and coriander in aroma, with herbs and weeds in aroma, like a summer field. In mout a vblend of IPA with a Saison, with herbal hops, clover field, medium bodied, at the Mondiale, June  2006. 8-4-8-3-15

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2008 Bottle Orange to amber hazy body. White, rocky/frothy head. Nice looks: big head and nice colour. Aroma of citrus, hops, orange, caramel, ... with clear stress on citric compounds. Heavily bitter, lightly sweet initial flavour. Moderately bitter finish. Flavour of hops (cascade) and anise. The bitterness is quite dry and balances of the edge of being pleasant. So nice beer, but maybe the bitterness should be a tad less tart

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2005  Drank under the name of  Cuvée du 4ième Anniversaire  which was its near identical predecessor. 
Hazy golden beer with orange shine, well carbonated; whipped-cream like head, irregular. Superb fine hops nose, combined with honey, honingbollen and nectar-laden blossoms. Phenomenal combination. Again honey, with a very hop-bitter finish. Superb balance, superb combination. Some citrus (hoppy ), tad metallic. Light, superb session beer. WOW! This is pure genius. MORE! More, please, Grégory...

Pours with a pale yellow body topped by a thick, creamy head with lots of lacing.  Its sweet and yeasty with a light fruitiness, a light floral note and a little grassiness.  Light to medium bodied and dry.

Not sure if i should be thanking DarkElf or cquiroga for this one...  pours a light yellow/golden color with a decent sized head and lots of lacing that remained on the glass.  aroma is citrusy (almost fruity) with grassy and floral undertones.  Flavor is light w/ slight fruit undertones and hints of grass and some spices.  I really enjoyed this beer!

Poured a lightly hazy, golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of citrus, yeast, spices, and faint floral hoppiness in the background.  Taste of orange peel, citrus, grassy hops, yeast, and some spices, which was very well balanced, leading to a crisp mouthfeel.  really nice Belgian Ale.

I hate rating after TAR, it feels like I should just say "what he said, kinda with a lower rating". Anyway, I had this on tap at the Dilly Deli with TAR, MAP and JCW. Had no idea what a special treat I was getting at the time. Cloudy with a disappearing billowy head. Tons of sharp lemon, orange peel and yeast. A lot of dense, bright and crisp hop flavor but nothing that screams IPA. Definitely refined in every aspect. Slightly spritzy mouthfeel. Lasting herbal and doughy finish with echoes of orange essence. Tasty.

Draft: Deep golden. Thin film of head yields abundant white lace. Tantalizing scents of perfumey hops, lemon zest, lavender, fennel, and white pepper. Semi-prickly carbonation, but richly creamy and soft. Rustically flavored, charged with an herbal-laced sharpness, yet pillow-soft with yeast, mandarin oranges,  and toasted dough. Peach fuzz bitterness gently scrapes the tongue and accentuates the dryness. Sassy yeast character displays some mustiness and a hint of bubblegum, but the doughy aspects are much more evident, which film the tongue and highlight the peppery hop sting. Dry, rife with spicy phenols, and highly appetizing as a result. Very little brett, however. Possesses just enough fruitiness to deepen the bodys hardness. Dry finish with an equal dose of lavender and white pepper topped with a dainty interplay of spicy hops, sassy yeast spice, and lingering doughy malts. I was hoping for more brett, but the yeast is still plenty herbal and characterful. So fun and uplifting.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: On tap at Dilly Deli.  This was quite a suprise.  Slightly spicy floral aroma and a strong yellow color.  Flavor has some very pleasant sweet hop presence.  Palate comes off as sticky then rolls back into the throat with a bitter smooth dry feel.  This was a really fine belgian, considerably more hoppy than expected, and very delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2007 On tap @ the Dilly Deli.  This has been the best beer Ive had this summer.  Light gold color, translucent with a white foamy head.  Looks a lot like a pilsner.  Aroma of fruit, yeast, spice(pepper) and hops.  The bite in this beer reminded me a bit of Oval.  The citrusy flavors were more of an undertone to the spiceness.  Finish was slightly dry, with the hops lingering until the "bitter end".  Excellent beer.

Snifter draft at Dilly Deli in Cincinnati. Hazy amber with moderate rocky head that diminished slowly. Good aroma of citrus, yeast and hops. Medium body. Full complex hops, fruit and spice flavor with a small bitter long finish. Very good Belgian Ale.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2005 Bottle at the Rulles brewery. Golden with nice white head. Fruity, hops, herbal and spicy, lightly resinous, lingering bitterness. Just lovely...(4.0). And it just gets better and better each time I have it; tropical touch to the fruitness - unripe pineapple, grapefruit. A great session-beer.

Pale golden, nice white filmy head lasts until the end. Exquisite fresh citrus nose, boastful dry tangerine, marmalade, floral amarillos, delicate hay and gentle belgian yeast. Light, almost crisp pils malts, slightly biscuity, but the hops dominate, I’m told they are of 3-4 different varieties, the aroma ones being all american. It is fairly hoppy, could be a Saison with american hops. A gentle herbal tartness procures extra balance on top of an awe-inspiring ease to drink by big sips. Plentiful hay harvest. Heavy citrus component, marrying with the saisonish funky yeast like a natural. Light-medium body, excellent mouth-cleaning carbonation, impressive balance. This blends together the liveliness of the best hoppy american ales with the charming rural Ardennes yeast character. Certainly one of the best summer beers anywhere and anywhen.
Gold with white head. Mild citric/spice aroma. Zesty spicy refreshing flavour. Medium bodied, tasty ale.
Tap at andys.  This was a good summer brew. Fruity but not over the top, good mix of sweet and bitter and malt character. Easy drinking and refreshing. I smelled and tasted bits of banana and clove.

On tap at Andys. Yellow and cloudy in color with a nice white fluffy head. Hoppy, malty fruity aroma. Banana and clove notes. Very hoppy aroma. Well balanced. Malty and hoppy flavor. Banana and clove notes. Medium bodied. Drinkable summer beer. Smooth. Enjoyable.

Tap at Andys. Billed as a special B-United brew only, if you can believe it ;-). Hazy yellow, white head. Clovey banana hop aroma, nicely balanced. Flavor is pale malts and hops, and lots of em in the flavor. Bitterness is balanced with the maltiness. Some spicy clove notes in the flavor as well. Real nice summer beer. Also submitted the description that B United gave to me to be added...
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: wow!! excellent. farmyard ale tops. fruity hoppy nose. tastes bitter with lots of grapefruit citrus(good hop), little sweet and spicy(peppery). very dry finish which is very long and fruity. 5.2% abv. unbelievable. very good!

Bottled (beer #10) at the Croydon Draught Beer Festival. This looks like a new beer from Rulles, and a very good one. As the turnover of draught beers was a bit slow, we found ourselves drinking a number of the bottled beers that were available - principally for take away as they were not chilled at all. Despite the imperfect serving conditions, the Rulles beers nearly stole the show. This one was quite rustic and earthy - almost in a saison style - with some farmyardy hints, zippy orangey hops and a bit of yeasty character. In fact the yeast is very slightly intrusive, hense it loses a mark or two. Dry and noticeably sharp, although manages to be quite soft at the same time. Excellent stuff.
